Explosive Death.name: 爆炸性死亡 Explosive Death
Explosive Death.description: 当骷髅被摧毁时，它的骨头会破碎然后爆炸，和支撑它的死灵能量一并放射出去。相邻的生物受到@Damage[1d6[slashing]]伤害，@Check[reflex|dc:15|basic]豁免。

Explosive Monolith (3-4).name: Explosive Monolith (3-4)
Explosive Monolith (3-4).disable:
@Check[arcana|dc:17], @Check[occultism|dc:17], or @Check[religion|dc:17] to magically alter the runes, or @Check[thievery|dc:20] to physically alter them. A PC that can read Abyssal or Cyclops is better able to identify key runes, gaining a +1 circumstance bonus to these check (+2 if they speak both).

Each check requires two actions, and disabling the monolith requires three successful checks. A PC that critically succeeds earns two success. On a failed check, the attempting PC is exposed to the burning flames wreathing the monolith, taking @Damage[2d6[fire]] damage(@Check[reflex|dc:17|basic|name:Explosive Monolith])。
Explosive Monolith (3-4).hazarddescription: A burst of abyssal energy ignites the sap in a nearby bruorsivi, which explodes in a burst of fiery splinters。
Explosive Monolith (3-4).routine:
(1动作) On the hazard's turn, randomly select a PC within 40 feet of the monolith. A tree near that PC explodes in a @Template[burst|distance:10], dealing [[/r {1d6[piercing],1d6[fire]}]]{1d6 piercing damage and 1d6 fire伤害}. Each creature in the area must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:17|name:Explosive Monolith|traits:damaging-effect]豁免。

大成功 生物不受伤害。

成功 The creature takes half damage。

失败 The creature takes full damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} for 1 round。

大失败 The creature takes double damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} for 1 round。

Flares.name: Flares
Flares.description:
Trigger A creature other than the monolith's guardians approaches within 40 feet of the monolith

Effect the flames wreathing the monolith flare with incandescent light. The triggering creature must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:17] save.

On a failure, the creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} for one round.

On a critical failure, the creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} for one round, then @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} for one round.

The hazard rolls initiative.

Explosive Monolith (5-6).name: Explosive Monolith (5-6)
Explosive Monolith (5-6).disable:
@Check[arcana|dc:20], @Check[occultism|dc:20], or @Check[religion|dc:20] to magically alter the runes, or @Check[thievery|dc:23] to physically alter them. A PC that can read Abyssal or Cyclops is better able to identify key runes, gaining a +1 circumstance bonus to these check (+2 if they speak both)。

Each check requires two actions, and disabling the monolith requires three successful checks. A PC that critically succeeds earns two success. On a failed check, the attempting PC is exposed to the burning flames wreathing the monolith, taking @Damage[2d6[fire]]伤害 (@Check[reflex|dc:20|basic|name:Explosive Monolith])。

A tree near that PC explodes in a @Template[burst|distance:10], dealing [[/r {2d6[piercing],2d6[fire]}]]{2d6 piercing damage and 2d6 fire伤害}. Each creature in the area must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:20|name:Explosive Monolith|traits:damaging-effect]豁免。

失败 The creature takes full damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} for 1 round。

Famished Mimic.name: Famished Mimic
Famished Mimic.publicNotes:
Thought to be the result of a failed experiment meant to animate objects or a sinister alghollthu creation, mimics are clever monsters that can take the form of common manufactured objects. Mimics are ambush predators and voracious eaters, surprising their prey through their uncanny ability to mimic the form of common furniture and miscellany. They remain disguised until unsuspecting adventurers happen by, then they lash out in ambush。

Mimics possess complex alien minds, and while often cruel and self-serving, they also enjoy conversation with their prey from time to time. For unknown reasons, they are especially interested in humanoids. Mimics have a strong dislike for others of their kind and tend to live alone. A mimic can remain in its alternate form for an extremely long period of time, sometimes remaining disguised in a dungeon chamber for decades. Regardless of how long it waits, the mimic remains vigilant and alert, ready to strike at any moment。

Object Lesson.name: Object Lesson
Object Lesson.description:
Trigger A creature touches or physically interacts with the mimic while the mimic is transformed using Mimic Object.

Effect The triggering creature is automatically stuck by the mimic's adhesive (it receives no save). The mimic then makes a pseudopod Strike against any creature adjacent to the mimic.

Object Lesson can't be used again until the mimic escapes and takes on a new disguise.

Adhesive.name: Adhesive
Adhesive.description:
The mimic is coated in an adhesive slime. Any creature that hits the mimic, is hit by the mimic, or otherwise touches the mimic must succeed at a @Check[reflex|dc:21] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} ([[/act escape dc=21]]). A weapon that hits the mimic is stuck to the mimic and can be removed with a successful @Check[athletics|dc:23] check (made as a single action).

A mimic can have any number of objects or creatures stuck to it at a time. The mimic can release a stuck creature or object by using a single action, and the adhesive dissolves 1 minute after the mimic dies, releasing all stuck objects and creatures.

Mimic Object.name: Mimic Object
Mimic Object.description: The mimic assumes the shape of any Medium object. This doesn't change the mimic's texture or overall size but can alter its coloration and visual appearance. It has an automatic result of 26 on Deception checks and DCs to pass as the object that it's mimicking.

Fence (PFS 2-00).name: Fence (PFS 2-00)
Fence (PFS 2-00).publicNotes:
The longer criminals hold on to stolen loot, the greater the chance they will get caught. Fences make themselves indispensable in the underworld by paying for stolen goods in order to resell them later, whether through a seemingly legitimate business or to a closed group of elite buyers。

Some criminals are the desperate who have no option but to break the law to survive, while others choose a life of crime for thrills, forming gangs or underworld guilds that specialize in certain illegal ventures。

Fence's Eye.name: Fence's Eye
Fence's Eye.description: Fences live by their ability to recognize a viable trade. They can use Underworld Lore to identify an item's value and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.eReSHVEPCsdkSL4G]{Identify Magic} on an item. They gain a +2 circumstance bonus to Underworld Lore checks when doing so, and to Underworld Lore checks to determine whether an item was stolen, whether a stolen item would be too recognizable to easily move, and who would be interested in purchasing such an item.

Quick Rummage.name: Quick Rummage
Quick Rummage.description: The fence always has a few items close at hand. The fence @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.pvQ5rY2zrtPI614F]{Interacts} to draw a weapon or item that takes a single action to activate, and then @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.VjxZFuUXrCU94MWR]{Strikes} with the weapon or activates the item.

Scoundrel's Feint.name: Scoundrel's Feint
Scoundrel's Feint.description: When the fence successfully @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.QNAVeNKtHA0EUw4X]{Feints}, their target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} against the fence's attacks until the end of the fence's next turn. On a critical success, the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} against all attacks until the end of the fence's next turn.

Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description: The fence deals an extra 2d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

Slow.name: Slow
Slow.description: A zombie is permanently @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} and can't use reactions.

Jet.description: The grindylow moves up to 60 feet in a straight line through the water without triggering reactions. It can use this ability while grabbing a creature.
Jet.name: Jet

Tangling Kelp.name: Tangling Kelp
Tangling Kelp.description:
Trigger A creature attempts a melee attack against a zombie grindylow with a bludgeoning or slashing weapon

Effect The creature must succeed at a @Check[reflex|dc:15] saving throw or become tangled in the kelp that surrounds the zombie grindylow, giving the creature a -10 circumstance penalty to its Speeds until it spends a manipulate action to remove the kelp.

Clinging Suckers.description:
When a grindylow Grabs a creature larger than itself, it attaches to that creature. The grabbed creature is not immobilized, but if it moves, the grindylow moves with it.

If the creature is Medium or smaller, it takes a –5-foot status penalty to its Speeds while the grindylow is attached. The grindylow is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} while it is attached to a creature.
Clinging Suckers.name: Clinging Suckers

Slow.name: Slow
Slow.description: A zombie is permanently @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} and can't use reactions.

Searing Aura.name: Searing Aura
Searing Aura.description:
10 feet. The fire-eye zombie emits an aura of heat that causes open wounds to sizzle.

Any living creature that starts its turn within 10 feet of the zombie and isn't at full HP must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:17|traits:damaging-effect] save or take @Damage[1d4[fire]] damage as its wounds burn.

Creatures critically hit by the fire-eye zombie's Strikes must attempt this saving throw immediately.

Eye Throwing.name: Eye Throwing
Eye Throwing.description:
A fire-eye zombie can launch its eye at foes. While its eye is out of its head, the fire-eye zombie is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded}.

At the end of its turn, a fire-eye zombie's eye flies back into its eye socket.

At the end of its turn, a fire-eye zombie's eye flies back into its eye socket.

Wide Swing.name: Wide Swing
Wide Swing.description: The fire-eye cyclops zombie makes a spiked club Strike and compares the attack roll result to the AC of up to two foes, each of whom must be within the Strike's reach. This attack counts as two attacks for the fire-eye zombie's multiple attack penalty.

Smoke Vision.description: Smoke doesn't impair a brimorak's vision; they ignore the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} condition from smoke.
Smoke Vision.name: Smoke Vision

Boiling Blood.name: Boiling Blood
Boiling Blood.description: Each time an adjacent creature deals slashing or piercing damage to the brimorak, the attacker is sprayed with the brimorak's boiling blood, which deals @Damage[3d4[fire]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:22|basic] save).

Extinguishing Aversion.name: Extinguishing Aversion
Extinguishing Aversion.description: Dousing a brimorak with water, either ordinary water or from a water effect, causes no physical harm to the fiend but deals @Damage[3d6[mental]] damage. Fully immersing the brimorak in water deals @Damage[5d6[mental]] damage per round.

Breath Weapon.name: Breath Weapon
Breath Weapon.description:
The brimorak spits their boiling blood in a @Template[line|distance:20] that deals @Damage[8d6[fire]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:24|basic|options:area-effect] save).

The brimorak can't use their Breath Weapon again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Breath Weapon]]{1d4 rounds}.

The ground within this area becomes slippery, with the effects of a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Wu0xFpewMKRK3HG8]{Grease} spell targeting an area until it's cleaned up or the brimorak is able to use their Breath Weapon again, whichever comes first.

Flaming Weapon.name: Flaming Weapon
Flaming Weapon.description: A brimorak's hooves and any weapon they wield burst into flame, dealing an extra @Damage[1d6[fire]] damage with each hit. If they don't have a weapon, they can create a flaming sword of fire and steel (see flaming sword Strike in Melee entry above).

Fume.name: Fume
Fume.description: The brimorak emits a cloud of thick black smoke in a @Template[burst|distance:10]{10-foot burst} that remains in place for [[/gmr 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}. All creatures within the smoke become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed}, and all creatures outside the smoke become concealed to creatures within it. A creature that enters or begins its turn within the smoke it must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:24] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} on a critical failure).

Flames of Verakivhan (3-4).name: Flames of Verakivhan (3-4)
Flames of Verakivhan (3-4).disable: @Check[nature|dc:17]或@Check[performance|dc:17] (受训) to remind the Finadar forest of its true self; or @Check[religion|dc:17], @Check[occultism|dc:17], or @Check[demon-lore|dc:17]{Demon Lore}(受训) to disrupt the connection to the imposed realm and extinguish one of the five sections of flames on the map. These checks can only be attempted by creatures adjacent to the section, and each attempt takes 2 actions. An extinguished fire still emits concealing smoke for 1 additional round but is no longer hot enough to deal damage. A @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} spell or a spell with the water trait (2nd level; counteract DC 15) extinguishes a section of flames. If the PCs disable three of the five sections of the flames of Verakivhan, the hazard is too weakened to sustain itself, and the remaining flames disappear. If there are no demons or elementals remaining in the area, the hazard is automatically disabled。
Flames of Verakivhan (3-4).hazarddescription: The demon lord Urxehl manifests upon Golarion a small region of his Abyssal realm, filled with constantly burning forests lashed by fierce storms and unholy rain that only further feeds the flames. This is a mystical fire, fueled by the presence of Urxehl's minions. Any flames on the map emit concealing smoke in a 10-foot radius around the fire。
Flames of Verakivhan (3-4).routine: (3 actions) Any creature within the flames takes @Damage[(1d6+3)[fire]] damage, and any creature adjacent to the flames takes @Damage[1d6[fire]]伤害 (@Check[reflex|dc:17|basic|name:Flames of Verakivhan|traits:fire] save). Additionally, the flames call down a fiery rain that deals @Damage[(1d6+3)[fire]] damage to a random PC within the planar overlay (@Check[reflex|dc:17|basic|name:Flames of Verakivhan|traits:fire] save). If any PCs attempted to disable the hazard that turn, the fiery rain chooses one of them as its target。

Ignite.name: Ignite
Ignite.description:
Trigger A creature that is not a demon or elemental enters the planar overlay

Effect Flames ignite throughout the area. The hazard rolls initiative.

Explode.description: When the flaming eye dies, it explodes in a violent burst of flame, dealing @Damage[2d6[fire]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:16|basic|options:area-effect] save) to creatures in a @Template[burst|distance:5].

@Template[emanation|distance:5]{5尺} @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.v61oEQaDdcRpaZ9X]{灵光}

The monolith's guardians are accustomed to these surges and are immune to this effect。

Foretold Ruin (1-2).hazarddescription: Daemonic curses slither and crawl through malevolent runes carved in four stone pillars. HP is per-pillar。
Foretold Ruin (1-2).routine:
Routine (4 actions) The trap loses 1 action each turn for each disabled pillar. On its initiative, the trap uses each action to afflict a different non-evil creature in the room with thirst. The creature must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:17|name:Foretold Ruin|traits:damaging-effect]豁免。

大成功 The creature is temporarily immune to additional negative effects from the foretold ruin hazard's reaction for 24 hours. The hazard has no awareness of this immunity and continues to target this creature。

These actions have the verbal trait. Each check to disable the hazard requires 2 actions, and two total successes are required to disable the haunt。
Hands of Slow Death.hazarddescription: A pile of dust and bone meal, several inches deep and 10 feet across on each side, blocks the tunnel to the surface. It is suffused with the despair of the slowly dying, and summons vengeful skeletal hands to hunt down anyone who dares attempt to leave the area。
Hands of Slow Death.reset: The haunt deactivates if no creatures remain within 30 feet but resets immediately thereafter unless disabled. If tthe haunt is disabled, it resets after 24 hours。
Hands of Slow Death.routine: (1动作) Spectral hands grasp at creatures in the area. Each creature within 30 feet of the dust pile takes @Damage[1d4[void]]伤害 (@Check[will|dc:17|basic|name:Grasping Hands] save; creatures that critically fail this saving throw are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for 1轮)。

Summon Crawling Hands.name: Summon Crawling Hands
Summon Crawling Hands.description:
Trigger A creature comes within 30 feet of the remains

The hands roll initiative and remain for 7 rounds, after which the summoning spell ends and the hands disappear. The hands also disappear if someone disables the trap before the duration expires.

The summoned hands can use 3 actions each round and can use reactions, unlike most summoned creatures.

The hunting spider moves straight down up to 40 feet, suspended by a web line. It can hang from the web or drop off. The distance it Descends on a Web doesn't count for falling damage.

Jinkin (PFS 2-00).name: Jinkin (PFS 2-00)
Jinkin (PFS 2-00).publicNotes:
Jinkins are sadistic tinkers who steal and sabotage items and take great pride in their power to curse precious objects. They hold grudges and create convoluted plans for revenge whenever they feel slighted, such as when a creature dares to remove one of their curses. Rarely content to wreak simple mayhem, jinkins also take immense pleasure in torture and murder, though they prefer to lead victims into traps designed to capture or incapacitate rather than kill outright. Deep pits are favorites, since victims who survive the fall face a slow death from starvation and thirst. Jinkins enjoy gathering at the edge of pits to mock, tease, and torment。

Gremlins are cruel fey tricksters and saboteurs who have fully acclimated to life on the Material Plane, finding distinct niches for their inventive destructiveness. All gremlins delight in ruining or breaking things, whether it's something physical like a device or vehicle or something intangible such as an alliance or relationship. A gremlin's greatest joy is watching the collapse of complex creations, preferably after the lightest and slightest, carefully targeted push from the gremlin. Gremlins tend to denigrate, bully, or even slaughter their lesser kin, particularly mitflits, whom gremlins (and many others) derisively call "mites."

Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description: The jinkin deals 1d6 extra precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

Tinker.name: Tinker
Tinker.description: A group of six jinkins can work together for an hour to imbue an item with a curse at a range of 60 feet. While this process is lengthy, it's also unobtrusive and can be performed while @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.XMcnh4cSI32tljXa]{Hiding}. Jinkins prefer to use this ability on magic items. The curse makes the item unreliable (@Check[flat|dc:5] check or waste any action to Interact with or Activate the item), adds a bizarre requirement to use the item, or imparts some other curse of a similar caliber.

Once the guardian is reduced to less than half its Hit Points, or immediately upon being damaged by a critical hit, its construct armor breaks and its Armor Class is reduced to 20.

Kobold Warrior (PFS 2-11).name: Kobold Warrior (PFS 2-11)
Kobold Warrior (PFS 2-11).publicNotes:
The typical kobold trains with agile weaponry, favoring the light pick for its use in crafting new tunnels to expand their domains through underground reaches. Kobolds are capable of landing sneaky strikes against unsuspecting foes but are just as quick to scamper off to safety when they don't, as a group, outnumber their enemies at least two to one。

Kobolds are small, reptilian humanoids who carry physical similarities to true dragons. They lurk in dark spaces, usually tunnels and mines beneath the earth, in either warrens of their own design or complexes discovered and colonized after the original builders have moved on. Though kobolds are far more pragmatic than they are courageous, they use every inch of their cunning to even the playing field between themselves and other, stronger creatures. They attack from the darkness and at range, and kobold artificers and engineers master the art of simple but effective traps, which they use to protect their lairs. Kobolds are skilled at working together by necessity, and they often set up ambushes or hit-and-run assaults that allow them to do the most damage possible without being harmed in return。

Kobolds are diligent and hardworking creatures, though they often turn these virtues toward selfish ends. While some kobolds live in communal collectives that maintain neutral relations with the creatures around them, they can be easily swayed into serving malevolent powers or megalomaniac leaders. This is in part due to kobolds' innate pragmatism, as they would rather concede to servitude than risk being killed, but it is also in part due to a reverence for the power that kobolds generally lack. Dragons in particular are viewed with a deferential awe, and kobolds eagerly offer their services to such mighty and glorious creatures when they can. While kobolds may scheme against other leaders, especially those that control them via subjugation, dragons are usually viewed with adoration, no matter how brutal they might be to their kobold minions。

Hurried Retreat.name: Hurried Retreat

Requirements The kobold warrior is adjacent to at least one enemy.

Effect The kobold warrior Strides up to its Speed plus 5 feet and gains a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against reactions triggered by this movement. It must end this movement in a space that's not adjacent to any enemy.

Rapid Lead Poison.name: 迅猛铅毒 Rapid Lead Poison
Rapid Lead Poison.description:
大量的铅会造成头痛、难以集中注意力和关节疼痛。死灵魔法增强了骷髅表面的铅，使之生效速度远远快于一般的铅中毒。

豁免检定 @Check[fortitude|dc:18]

最大持续时间 4轮

阶段1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{呆滞 Stupefied 1}（1轮）

阶段2 @Damage[1d6[poison]]伤害，呆滞1和@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{笨拙 Clumsy 1}（1轮）

阶段3 @Damage[2d6[poison]]伤害，@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{呆滞 Stupefied 2}和@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{笨拙 Clumsy 2}（2轮）

Lesser Bruorsivi Mandragora.name: 弱化的血松曼德拉 Lesser Bruorsivi Mandragora

7Dwwk4c4cBxweZKc.name: 血液嗅觉 （模糊） 30 尺
7Dwwk4c4cBxweZKc.description: 曼德拉可以在30尺范围内以模糊地闻到有血液的生物，也可以在30尺范围内以精确地闻到有血液的恶魔、精类和术士。

Blood Drain.name: 吸血 Blood Drain
Blood Drain.description:
需求 曼德拉正在@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{受擒 Grabbed}一个生物；

效果 曼德拉从被擒抱的生物身上吸取血液，造成[[/r 1d6]]{1d6伤害}。如果这个生物是恶魔、精类或术士。曼德拉将获得等同于造成伤害数值的临时生命值。被曼德拉吸血的生物@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{流失 Drained 1}，直到它受到任何形式的治疗。

Bruorsivi Sap Infusion.name: 血松树汁 Bruorsivi Sap Infusion
Bruorsivi Sap Infusion.description:
豁免检定 @Check[fortitude|dc:18]

最大持续时间 6轮

阶段1 @Damage[1d6[fire]]伤害和@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{呆滞 Stupefied 1}（1轮）

阶段2 @Damage[1d6[fire]]伤害和呆滞1（1轮）

阶段3 @Damage[2d6[fire]]伤害和呆滞1（1轮）

Piercing Shriek.name: 刺耳尖啸 Piercing Shriek
Piercing Shriek.description:
频率 每天一次

效果 曼德拉发出骇人的尖叫。30尺内的每个非曼德拉的生物必须尝试@Check[will|dc:20]豁免。

大成功 生物不受影响。

成功 生物@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{恶心 Sickened 1}。

失败 生物@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{恶心 Sickened 2}。

大失败 生物恶心2并@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{缓慢 Slowed 1}。只要生物还处于惊惧状态，缓慢状态就不会被移除。

Blood Scent (Imprecise) 30 feet.name: Blood Scent (Imprecise) 30 feet
Blood Scent (Imprecise) 30 feet.description: A mandragora can smell creatures with blood as an imprecise sense at a range of 30 feet, and it can smell demons, fey, and sorcerers with blood as a precise sense at a range of 30 feet.

Lesser Skeletal Cyclops.name: 弱化的骷髅独眼巨人 Lesser Skeletal Cyclops

equipment-Long Bone.name: 长骨 Long Bone
equipment-Long Bone.description:
功能如长棒。

这根粗壮而纤细的棍子末端呈锥形，平衡良好。它被设计成一种攻守兼备的武器。

Broad Swipe.name: 广域横扫 Broad Swipe
Broad Swipe.description: 巨人使用长棒对触及范围内的两名敌人各发动一次打击。在这两次攻击完成前多重攻击减值不会增加。

Explosive Death.name: 爆炸性死亡 Explosive Death
Explosive Death.description: 当骷髅被摧毁时，它的骨头会破碎然后爆炸，和支撑它的死灵能量一并放射出去。相邻的生物受到@Damage[1d6[slashing]]伤害，@Check[reflex|dc:15|basic]豁免。

Terrifying Charge.name: 恐怖冲锋 Terrifying Charge
Terrifying Charge.description: 巨人行进并且使用爪抓打击，这次爪抓打击在伤害上拥有+2环境加值。如果打击命中，巨人对目标尝试一次@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.action-macros.Macro.nEwqNNWX6scLt4sc]{挫败士气}。

Lion (PFS 2-13).name: Lion (PFS 2-13)
Lion (PFS 2-13).publicNotes:
Lions are cooperative hunters, ambushing dangerous prey in groups of lionesses that work in tandem to trap and kill their prey. Male lions are typically larger, with long manes, and when they hunt, they tend to do so on their own。

Few predators of the natural world can match the cat's talent for stalking and stealth。

Pack Attack.name: Pack Attack
Pack Attack.description: The lion deals 1d4 extra damage to any creature that's within reach of at least two of the lion's allies.

Pounce.name: Pounce
Pounce.description: The lion Strides and makes a Strike at the end of that movement. If the lion began this action @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden}, it remains hidden until after this ability's Strike.

Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description: The lion deals 1d6 extra precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

General's Cry.name: General's Cry
General's Cry.description: When a hobgoblin general rolls initiative, as long as they can perceive at least one foe, they can yell a mighty battle cry. The hobgoblin general attempts an Intimidate check to [[/act demoralize]] a single foe within 60 feet as a free action. If successful, any ally with the goblin trait can, as its first action on its first turn of the combat, Stride up to double its speed as a single action.

Polearm Critical Specialization.name: Polearm Critical Specialization
Polearm Critical Specialization.description: On a critical hit, the target of the critical hit is moved 5 feet in a direction of Morgroar's choice.

Formation.name: Formation
Formation.description: When Morgroar is adjacent to at least two other allies, he gains a +1 circumstance bonus to AC and saving throws. This bonus increases to +2 to Reflex saves against area effects.
When Morgroar is adjacent to at least two other allies, he gains a +1 circumstance bonus to AC and saving throws. This bonus increases to +2 to Reflex saves against area effects.

Mechanical Jaws (1-2).name: Mechanical Jaws (1-2)
Mechanical Jaws (1-2).hazarddescription: Mechanical jaws bolted to the stone beneath a camouflaged floor tile。

Jaws.name: Jaws
Jaws.description:
Trigger A creature walks on the tile.

Effect The jaws of the trap snap shut, Striking the triggering creature. The triggering creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} until the trap is disabled or a creature succeeds at a [[/act force-open dc=12]]{Athletics} check to Force it Open. A creature who critically fails the check to Force it Open instead tightens the trap, dealing @Damage[(1d6+3)[piercing]] damage to the immobilized creature.

Mechanical Jaws (3-4).name: Mechanical Jaws (3-4)
Mechanical Jaws (3-4).hazarddescription: Mechanical jaws bolted to the stone beneath a camouflaged floor tile。

Jaws.name: Jaws
Jaws.description:
Trigger A creature walks on the tile.

Effect The jaws of the trap snap shut, Striking the triggering creature. The triggering creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} until the trap is disabled or a creature succeeds at a [[/act force-open dc=14]]{Athletics} check to Force it Open. A creature who critically fails the check to Force it Open instead tightens the trap, dealing @Damage[(2d6+6)[piercing]] damage to the immobilized creature.

Swarming Claws.description: Each enemy in the swarm's space takes @Damage[2d8[piercing]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:20|basic] save).
Swarming Claws.name: Swarming Claws

Breath Weapon.name: Breath Weapon
Breath Weapon.description:
The mephit swarm breathes energy in a @Template[cone|distance:15] that deals @Damage[1d6[acid],1d6[cold],1d6[electricity],1d6[fire]|options:area-damage] damage to each creature within the area (@Check[reflex|dc:20|basic|options:area-effect] save).

The mephit swarm can't use Breath Weapon again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Breath Weapon]]{1d4 rounds}.

The mephit swarm breathes energy in a @Template[cone|distance:15] that deals @Damage[1d10[acid],1d10[cold],1d10[electricity],1d10[fire]|options:area-damage] damage to each creature within the area (@Check[reflex|dc:22|basic|options:area-effect] save).

The mephit swarm can't use Breath Weapon again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Breath Weapon]]{1d4 rounds}.
Breath Weapon.name: Breath Weapon

Swarming Claws.name: Swarming Claws
Swarming Claws.description: Each enemy in the swarm's space takes @Damage[3d6[piercing]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:22|basic] save).

Trapped Prey.name: Trapped Prey
Trapped Prey.description: The mercenary trapper's attacks deal an extra 1d4 precision damage to creatures that are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} by a mechanical jaws trap.

Trapped Prey.name: Trapped Prey
Trapped Prey.description: The mercenary trapper's attacks deal an extra 1d6 precision damage to creatures that are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} by a mechanical jaws trap.

Mishka The Bear (5-6).name: 巨熊米什卡 Mishka The Bear (5-6)

Mirror Beam.name: 镜反光束 Mirror Beam
Mirror Beam.description: 米什卡可以用背后的镜子反射阳光来对高处或它背上的敌人发动远程攻击。

Rolling Thunder Trample.name: 滚雷践踏 Rolling Thunder Trample
Rolling Thunder Trample.description:
中型或更小体型，爪抓，@Check[reflex|dc:25|basic]豁免。

米什卡的践踏只是单纯滚过他们身上。豁免失败的生物@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{倒地 Prone}，此外，作为一个反应动作生物可以尝试一次运动检定进行擒抱，使用和滚雷践踏相同的DC，如果成功，他们抓住了米什卡的鬃毛。

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.Trample]

Rush.name: 冲锋 Rush
Rush.description: 米什卡行走然后打击。在行走时，米什卡的速度获得+10尺环境加值。

Maiden's Mending.description:
Frequency once per minute

Trigger Mother Forsythe casts a non-cantrip occult spell

Effect Mother Forsythe gains 2 temporary Hit Points that last until the end of her next turn.

Mist Child.name: Mist Child
Mist Child.description: Mother Forsythe blends in with unnatural subtlety. When she is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden}, the DC of the flat check to target her is increased to 6 if she's concealed or 12 if she's hidden.

Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description: Mother Forsythe deals 1d6 extra precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

Maiden's Mending.name: Maiden's Mending
Maiden's Mending.description:
Frequency once per minute

Trigger Mother Forsythe casts a non-cantrip occult spell

Effect Mother Forsythe gains 3 temporary Hit Points that last until the end of her next turn.

Mist Child.name: Mist Child
Mist Child.description: Mother Forsythe blends in with unnatural subtlety. When she is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden}, the DC of the flat check to target her is increased to 6 if she's concealed or 12 if she's hidden.

Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description: Mother Forsythe deals 2d6 extra precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

Rage.name: Rage
Rage.description:
Requirements Murta isn't @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued} or raging

Effect Murta gains 9 temporary Hit Points that last until the rage ends. While raging, she deals 8 additional damage with melee attacks, gains a +10-foot status bonus to her Speed, and takes a -1 penalty to AC. Murta can't use concentrate actions except Seek and rage actions. The rage lasts for 1 minute, until there are no enemies she can perceive, or until she falls unconscious.

Once the rage ends, Murta can't Rage again for 1 minute.

Raging Intimidation.name: Raging Intimidation
Raging Intimidation.description: While Murta is raging, her @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]{Demoralize} action gains the rage trait, allowing her to use it while raging.

Shoving Blow.name: Shoving Blow
Shoving Blow.description: Murta makes a mighty attack that knocks foes back. She makes a melee Strike. On a hit, the target is pushed back 5 feet. On a critical hit, the target is pushed back 10 feet

Mushroom Ring (1-2).disable: @Check[thievery|dc:15|traits:action:disable-device] (受训) or @Check[nature|dc:18] to rearrange the mushrooms to disrupt the portal (two actions); three successes are required to disable the portal

Mutated Trollhound.name: 突变巨魔犬 Mutated Trollhound
Mutated Trollhound.publicNotes:
巨魔犬淌着口水并且贪得无厌，它们看起来就像是变成小型犬类形态的巨魔。由于需要大量进食来维持它们提供再生能力的新陈代谢系统，成群的野生巨魔犬在它们所居住的山麓间徘徊，贪婪的饥饿感驱使它们捕食任何能遇到的猎物。在一些地区，巨魔们将巨魔犬当做宠物，利用它们敏锐的嗅觉来协助狩猎。

浑身散发着恶臭、遍布着流脓的脓包，巨魔犬是一种被称为燃血热疫的衰竭性传染病的携带者。被巨魔犬咬伤的生物会承受剧烈的体内疼痛，就好像受害者的血液在燃烧了一般。其他并发症包括失去肌肉协调性、充满浓汁的水泡、全面性的嗜睡和疲乏。除了会承受一些皮肤问题，巨魔和巨魔犬免疫燃血热疫。

巨魔犬在狩猎和战斗时无所畏惧，依靠它们的再生能力来坚持战斗。甚至火焰的威胁也不足以让他们退却，因为这些野兽根本就无法意识到火焰所意味着的危险。不过，火焰依然是对付巨魔犬最有效的工具之一；精明的猎人们知道要烧掉每一块可能是属于巨魔犬的残骸，因为它们的再生能力着实是过于可怕。

虽然巨魔们自己成功地驯化、训练了巨魔犬，甚至将其作为朋友对待，但对其他想要成为巨魔犬主人的人而言就不一样了。无论是因为会持续接触在巨魔犬带病的口水而受到阻碍（因为它们似乎永远都无法满足的饥饿），还是单纯因为它们恶劣的秉性和二话不说就咬人的性格，大多数想要以巨魔犬代替其他更为可靠的守护者的尝试都以痛苦、悲惨、外加一大群逃往内陆的巨魔犬而告终。如果放任自流，一群逃跑的巨魔犬会以相当快的速度繁殖，一小群巨魔犬在不到一年的时间里就会繁殖成对村庄拥有巨大威胁的群体。就如那些失败者所说，最好把巨魔犬留给巨魔！

Bloodfire Fever.name: 燃血热疫 Bloodfire Fever
Bloodfire Fever.description:
豁免检定 @Check[fortitude|dc:20]{ Fortitude}

阶段1 携带但不发病（1天）

阶段2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{力竭 Enfeebled 1}（1天）

阶段3 力竭1和@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{笨拙 Clumsy 1}（1天）

阶段4 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{力竭 Enfeebled 2}和@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{笨拙 Clumsy 2}（1天）

阶段5 力竭2，笨拙2和@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{疲乏 Fatigued}（1天）

Pack Attack.name: 群起攻之 Pack Attack
Pack Attack.description: 巨魔犬的打击对处于至少两名巨魔犬盟友触及内的生物造成额外[[/r 1d6]]伤害。

Nuglub (PFS 2-00).name: Nuglub (PFS 2-00)
Nuglub (PFS 2-00).publicNotes:
The "towering" hunchbacked nuglubs are among the largest gremlins, though they're not quite three feet tall. Nuglubs have three glowing blue eyes and black, oily hair on their head and back that covers them like a cloak. Nuglubs enjoy killing with a glee that other gremlins reserve for sabotage. Indeed, they spend long hours preparing ambushes for unwary travelers or plotting the murders of sleeping villagers. Though less technically inclined than their kin, nuglubs do enjoy building traps. They delight in stealthily constructing traps in places their victims consider familiar, such as front doors and the floors around beds. If someone else gets blamed for the mayhem the nuglub creates, all the better。

In combat, nuglubs focus on targets wearing metal armor. Some attribute this to envy on the part of the nuglubs, who find it difficult to fit armor on their twisted bodies. Nuglubs are particularly talented at causing those nearby to stumble over them and fall prone. Once an enemy falls to the ground, all the nuglubs descend upon the target, biting and scratching until nothing remains。

Nuglubs rarely gather in groups larger than half a dozen, as quarrels often lead to violence and cannibalism. A lone nuglub who bullies a group of smaller gremlins is more likely to get their way, and thus less likely to attack their allies。

Kneecapper.name: Kneecapper
Kneecapper.description:
Trigger A Medium creature within the nuglub's reach leaves a square during its move action

Effect The nuglub lashes out at the triggering creature's knees and tries to knock them @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}. The nuglub makes an @Check[acrobatics] check against the creature's Reflex DC. On a success, the target falls and lands prone.

Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description: A nuglub's Strikes deal an additional 1d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} targets, or 1d10 precision damage if the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.

Ogre Spider (PFS 2-18).name: Ogre Spider (PFS 2-18)
Ogre Spider (PFS 2-18).publicNotes: These terrifying creatures grow as large as elephants. The placement of their eyes above their wide mandibles evokes the grimacing visage of an ogre's leer. Ogres themselves find the appearance of ogre spider faces simultaneously amusing and adorable, but in most cases, ogres' attempts to keep these spiders as pets result in dead ogres and well-fed spiders。

Web Sense.description: The ogre spider has imprecise @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.j2wsK6IsW5yMW1jW]{Tremorsense} to detect the vibrations of creatures touching its web.
Web Sense.name: Web Sense

Web Trap.name: Web Trap
Web Trap.description: A creature hit by the ogre spider's web attack is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} and stuck to the nearest surface until it [[/act escape dc=22]]{Escapes}.

Eerie Flexibility.name: Eerie Flexibility
Eerie Flexibility.description: An ogre spider can fit through tight spaces as if it were a Large creature. While @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.kMcV8e5EZUxa6evt]{Squeezing}, it can move at its full speed.

Ogre Spider Venom.name: Ogre Spider Venom
Ogre Spider Venom.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:22]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[1d6[poison]] damage (1 round)

Stage 2 1d6 poison damage, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1}, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} (1 round)

Stage 3 @Damage[2d6[poison]] damage, clumsy 1, and enfeebled 1 (1 round)

Stage 4 2d6 poison damage, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2}, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} (1 round)

equipment-Dogpiercer Knife.name: 屠狗刀 Dogpiercer Knife
equipment-Dogpiercer Knife.description: 这种小型有刃的武器可以单手持握并在近战中刺伤生物。也可以用来投掷。

Handout Information.name: 事前信息 Handout Information
Handout Information.description: 在战斗中，奥格图普拥有仆从特征。每轮一次，任何PC可以使用一个动作命令奥格图普（该动作具有听觉、专注和语言特征），并让她获得两个动作。如果奥格图普的生命低于15，她立刻窜逃、钻进雪堆，直到安全才出来。如果奥格图普的生命值被降为0，她立刻失去意识，但不会陷入濒死。

Sidle-Stab!-Scamper.name: 跑！刺！溜！ Sidle-Stab!-Scamper
Sidle-Stab!-Scamper.description: 奥格图普行走一次，在行走的任意时点进行一次打击。

Sneak Attack.name: 偷袭 Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description: 奥格图普对@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{措手不及 Off-Guard}的目标额外造成@Damage[1d6[precision]]{1d6精准伤害}。

Frequency once per year

Effect Activating a special ritual taught through the Onyx Alliance, the agent teleports to a safe house located in the Shadow Plane.

Simultaneous with the teleportation, a @Template[emanation|distance:5] of darkness appears where the agent once stood. The darkness lasts for one minute.

Canny Reversal.description:

Effect The Onyx Alliance agent makes a melee Strike or Trip attempt against the opponent and then Steps.

Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description: The Onyx Alliance agents deal an additional 1d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

Skewer.description: Perizia makes a trident Strike, dealing an extra @Damage[1d4[bleed]] on a hit (@Damage[2d4[bleed]] on a critical hit).
Skewer.name: Skewer

It's My Desire.name: It's My Desire
It's My Desire.description:
Trigger A planar nixie uses Grant Desire to grant Perizia's request

Effect Perizia uses her power over wishes to amplify the nixie's ability. The planar nixie can duplicate a spell of up to 3rd level instead of a spell of up to 2nd level.

Vortex.name: Vortex
Vortex.description: 40 feet. Water in the aura's emanation that is also in the same body of water as Perizia is difficult terrain for swimming creatures. Creatures with the water trait are immune.

Change Shape.name: Change Shape
Change Shape.description:
Perizia can take on the appearance of any water elemental or humanoid. This ability doesn't change her Speed or her attack and damage bonuses with her Strikes.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

Improvised Wishcraft.name: Improvised Wishcraft
Improvised Wishcraft.description:
Effect Perizia goads a creature into making a wish she can twist. Though Perizia isn't a noble genie and doesn't have access to the full power of the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.6dDtGIUerazSHIOu]{Wish} spell, her aspirations for power and studies of wishcraft have given her a lesser ability to twist the desires of others into ruin. The creature chooses the type of wish: a wish for power, a wish for wealth, or a wish for happiness. Once the type of wish is chosen, the creature attempts a @Check[will|dc:22] save. The effects of all granted wishes end after 1 hour. After attempting a saving throw, a creature is temporarily immune to this ability for 24 hours.

Critical Success The creature phrases its wish with the precision necessary to get a good outcome. The benefit it receives depends on the type of wish it made.

  • Wish for power-A burst of water empowers the creature's attacks. The creature's attacks deal an additional @Damage[1d4[bludgeoning]] damage.
  • Wish for wealth-A sack appears at the creature's waist, containing obvious fake coins and one of the following, of the creature's choice: 1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.G7haQ5gDt30ftJLC]{Healing Potion (Moderate)}, 1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.YHev1WJ2tOiTBg9o]{Oil of Unlife (Moderate)}, or 5 vials of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.97QyNEOAyYLdGaYc]{Bottled Lightning (Moderate)}. After 1 hour, all of these objects disappear.
  • Wish for happiness-The creature feels hopeful and inspired, gaining a +1 status bonus to attack rolls and saves against fear effects.

Success The creature resists making the wish.

Failure The creature's wish is twisted to cause it harm. The penalty it receives depends on the type of wish it made.

  • Wish for power-The creature's body is rapidly pushed to its limits of physical exertion and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued}.
  • Wish for wealth-The creature's pockets and bags fill with temporary treasures that resist all attempts to discard. The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.D5mg6Tc7Jzrj6ro7]{Encumbered}.
  • Wish for happiness-Tiny flashes of pleasant emotions and positive memories flicker across the creature's mind, interspersing with reality in a profoundly disorienting manner. The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}, and can't reduce this condition until the effects of the wish end.

Critical Failure The creature phrases its wish poorly, and Perizia easily twists the outcome. In addition to the failure effect of the creature's chosen type of wish, the creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1}.

It's My Desire.name: It's My Desire
It's My Desire.description:
Trigger A planar nixie uses Grant Desire to grant Perizia's request

Effect Perizia uses her power over wishes to amplify the nixie's ability. The planar nixie can duplicate a spell of up to 4th level instead of a spell of up to 3rd level.

Vortex.description: 40 feet. Water in the aura's emanation that is also in the same body of water as Perizia is difficult terrain for swimming creatures. Creatures with the water trait are immune.

Pixie (PFS 2-00).name: Pixie (PFS 2-00)
Pixie (PFS 2-00).publicNotes:
Insatiably curious, overly excitable, and just a bit puckish, pixies are wanderers and tricksters who use their pixie dust to create all sorts of whimsical situations, as well as to defend themselves. Other creatures often have trouble understanding a pixie's rapid, rambling way of speaking。

Elusive, flighty, and ebullient, sprites are what many villagers first imagine when they hear the terms "fey" or "fairy." While their dispositions vary from the benevolent grig to the trickster pixie, all sprites share a connection to magic and diminutive size. This family of fey shares its name with its slightest and most populous member, the common sprite。

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Sprinkle Pixie Dust.name: Sprinkle Pixie Dust
Sprinkle Pixie Dust.description:
The pixie sprinkles pixie dust onto one of its arrows. If the pixie hits a creature with that arrow before the pixie's next turn, the arrow inflicts one of the following special effects instead of dealing damage. Each effect depends on the target's Will save. On a critical hit, the target treats its save result as one degree worse.

  • Charm @Check[will|dc:21|traits:emotion,enchantment,incapacitation,mental] (emotion, enchantment, incapacitation, mental) The target suffers the effects of a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.vLA0q0WOK2YPuJs6]{Charm} spell, except it doesn't gain a bonus to its save if the only hostile act was the pixie firing its bow, and the pixie can choose to direct the target's adoration toward another creature rather than itself.
  • Memory Loss @Check[will|dc:21|traits:divination,mental] (divination, mental) On a failed Will save, the target loses the last 5 minutes of its memory.
  • Sleep @Check[will|dc:21|traits:enchantment,incapacitation,mental,sleep] (enchantment, incapacitation, mental, sleep) The target suffers the effects of a 3rd-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.o4lRVTwSxnOOn5vl]{Sleep} spell.
  • Subdual @Check[will|dc:21|basic|traits:enchantment,mental,nonlethal] (enchantment, mental, nonlethal) The target takes @Damage[4d6[mental]] damage, depending on its basic Will save.

Pixie (PFS 2-00).allSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

Plague Zombie (PFS 2-15).name: Plague Zombie (PFS 2-15)
Plague Zombie (PFS 2-15).publicNotes:
Plague zombies are infested with hideous contagions。

A zombie's only desire is to consume the living. Unthinking and ever-shambling harbingers of death, zombies stop only when they're destroyed。

Slow.name: Slow
Slow.description: A zombie is permanently @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} and can't use reactions.

Zombie Rot.name: Zombie Rot
Zombie Rot.description:
An infected creature can't heal damage it takes from zombie rot until it has been cured of the disease.

Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:18]

Stage 1 carrier with no ill effect (1 day)

Stage 2 @Damage[1d6[void]] damage (1 day)

Stage 3 1d6 void damage (1 day)

Stage 4 1d6 void damage (1 day)

Stage 5 dead, rising as a plague zombie immediately

Planar Cracks (5-6).name: Planar Cracks (5-6)
Planar Cracks (5-6).disable: @Check[thievery|dc:24|name:Assemble a Seal|traits:environmental,magical] (受训) twice to assemble a seal using objects strongly grounded to the Material Plane, @Check[arcana|dc:22|name:Invoke Incantations|traits:environmental,magical] (受训) twice to invoke incantations to seal the cracks, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (3rd level, counteract DC 20) to counteract the cracks。
Planar Cracks (5-6).hazarddescription: The cracks scintillate and shift between the elemental planes, leaking perilous energy with each shift。
Planar Cracks (5-6).routine:
(1动作) A surge of energy strikes a random non-mephit creature in the foyer. Roll [[/r 1d4]] to determine the element of the energy surge。

1-Energy from the Plane of Air: the creature takes @Damage[2d8[electricity]]伤害 (@Check[reflex|dc:22|basic|name:Planar Cracks|traits:air,electricity] save); on a failure, the creature is pushed back 10 feet toward the entryway. The hazard gains the air and electricity traits for this round。

2-Energy from the Plane of Earth: the creature takes @Damage[2d8[bludgeoning]]伤害 (@Check[reflex|dc:22|basic|name:Planar Cracks|traits:earth] save); on a failed save, the creature is knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}. The hazard gains the earth trait for this round。

3-Energy from the Plane of Fire: the creature takes @Damage[(2d8+7)[fire]]伤害 (@Check[reflex|dc:22|basic|name:Planar Cracks|traits:fire] save). The hazard gains the fire trait for this round。

4-Energy from the Plane of Water: the creature takes @Damage[2d8[cold]]伤害 (@Check[reflex|dc:22|basic|name:Planar Cracks|traits:water,cold] save); on a failed save, the creature's lungs fill with water, making them @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{恶心 Sickened 1}. The hazard gains the cold and water traits for this round。

Elemental Surge.name: Elemental Surge
Elemental Surge.description:
Trigger A non-mephit creature enters the manor

Effect Raw elemental energy seeps into the Material Plane. The hazard rolls initiative.

Planar Cracks (7-8).name: Planar Cracks (7-8)
Planar Cracks (7-8).disable: @Check[thievery|dc:28|name:Assemble a Seal|traits:environmental,magical] (专家) twice to assemble a seal using objects strongly grounded to the Material Plane, @Check[arcana|dc:26|name:Invoke Incantations|traits:environmental,magical] (受训) twice to invoke incantations to seal the cracks, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (4th level, counteract DC 22) to counteract the cracks。

The hazard gains the earth trait for this round。

3-Energy from the Plane of Fire: the creature takes @Damage[(2d10+9)[fire]]伤害 (@Check[reflex|dc:25|basic|name:Planar Cracks|traits:fire] save). The hazard gains the fire trait for this round。

The hazard gains the cold and water traits for this round。

Planar Nixie.name: Planar Nixie
Planar Nixie.allSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

Wild Empathy.name: Wild Empathy
Wild Empathy.description: The planar nixie can use Diplomacy to [[/act make-an-impression]] on and make very simple [[/act request]]{Requests} of aquatic or amphibious animals and elementals.

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Grant Desire.name: Grant Desire
Grant Desire.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect The planar nixie can duplicate a spell of up to 2nd level, but only in response to the request or desire of a non-fey creature. The creature whose desire is granted can never again benefit from that particular planar nixie's Grant Desire ability.

Pressurized Bottle (1-2).name: 充满压力的烧瓶 Pressurized Bottle (1-2)
Pressurized Bottle (1-2).disable: @Check[thievery|dc:17|name:Pressurized Bottle|traits:mechanical,trap] (受训)小心地用桶或碗把烧瓶扣在下面。
Pressurized Bottle (1-2).hazarddescription: 这瓶药水已经发酵成了毒药，内部还产生了巨大的压力。如果处理不当，瓶子会瞬间爆裂，碎片横飞。

Brittle Shatter.name: 脆性反应 Brittle Shatter
Brittle Shatter.description:
触发 有人试图拿起或移动药剂；

效果 烧瓶炸裂，在@Template[burst|distance:5]范围内的造成[[/r 1[piercing]]]伤害 (@Check[reflex|dc:19|basic]豁免)。受伤的生物会受到发酵药剂的影响。

Fermented Poison.name: 发酵药剂 Fermented Poison

Pressurized Bottle (3-4).hazarddescription: 这瓶药水已经发酵成了毒药，内部还产生了巨大的压力。如果处理不当，瓶子会瞬间爆裂，碎片横飞。

Quickling (PFS 2-00).name: Quickling (PFS 2-00)
Quickling (PFS 2-00).publicNotes:
Few creatures can match a quickling's speed. These malicious fey creatures delight in striking with blinding speed and accuracy, racing in to stab and slash at foes before scampering away for cover with maddening- even frightening-swiftness. Stories of people simply doubling over, bleeding from what appear to be spontaneously opening wounds, are often eyewitness accounts of quickling attacks。

Quicklings actively hate the "slow-paced dullards" they encounter every day, delighting in inflicting suffering and pain on creatures they deem too sluggish to matter. While they are related to kinder fey such as brownies and pixies, quicklings care only for their own merriment. They see their own cruel pranks as the height of humor and have full confidence that their speed and invisibility will keep them safe from harm. They occasionally form gangs of up to a dozen individuals, although the group usually devolves very quickly into mayhem, as they inevitably perform increasingly deadly pranks against each other。

Can't Catch Me.name: Can't Catch Me
Can't Catch Me.description:
Trigger The quickling is targeted by a Strike

Effect The quickling darts aside, gaining a +2 circumstance bonus to AC, then Strides up to half their Speed after the Strike resolves.

Slow Susceptibility.name: Slow Susceptibility
Slow Susceptibility.description: The quickling takes a -2 status penalty to saving throws against effects that cause the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed} condition. If the quickling ever becomes slowed, they lose their supernatural speed, can't Fade from View, and become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} for the duration of the slow. They also can't reduce this sickened condition for the duration of the slowed effect.

Fade from View.name: Fade from View
Fade from View.description:
Requirements The quickling used no attack, manipulate, or move actions in the previous round

Effect The quickling becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.zJxUflt9np0q4yML]{Invisible} until it uses an attack, manipulate, or move action.

The quickling can't use Fade from View again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Fade from View]]{1d4 rounds}.

Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description: The quickling's Strikes deal an extra 1d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

Supernatural Speed.name: Supernatural Speed
Supernatural Speed.description: The quickling's speed, combined with nearly instantaneous acceleration and deceleration, enables them to move in astonishing ways. As long as they have a firm surface to travel across, they can Stride their full movement vertically or horizontally. They can even run across unstable surfaces, such as water, in the same way, although dangerous surfaces (acid, lava, etc.) harm them as normal. They must end their movement on a horizontal surface capable of bearing their weight or else they fall.

Blood Siphon.description:
Trigger A creature within 60 feet takes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.lDVqvLKA6eF3Df60]{Persistent Bleed Damage}.

Effect The shed blood disperses into a fine mist that Qxal siphons up with their proboscis. Qxal regains @Damage[14[healing]] Hit Points.
Blood Siphon.name: Blood Siphon

Hallucinatory Scale Dust.name: Hallucinatory Scale Dust
Hallucinatory Scale Dust.description:
30 feet. Fey glamours shed from Qxal's wings like scale dust, causing hallucinations. A creature entering the aura or starting its turn in the area must attempt a @Check[will|dc:25] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected and is temporarily immune to the scale dust for 24 hours.

Success The creature is unaffected.

Failure The creature hallucinates that it is beginning to transform into a plant or animal native to their homeland, becoming either @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1}, at Qxal's choice. The condition lasts for 1 hour. Each time a creature fails this save, Qxal can choose an additional condition.

Critical Failure As failure, but the condition value is 2 (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2}).

Flutter.name: Flutter
Flutter.description: Qxal Flies. Any creature they pass within 30 feet of during their Flutter is exposed to their hallucinatory scale dust.

Grasping Visions.name: Grasping Visions
Grasping Visions.description: Qxal causes one creature within 60 feet who is under a condition from Qxal's hallucinatory scale dust aura to see visions of grasping vines and swarming insects, impeding the target's every move. All squares count as difficult terrain for that creature until the end of Qxal's next turn, and during that time they gain no benefit from any ability that would allow them to ignore difficult terrain.

Secret Spells.name: Secret Spells
Secret Spells.description: Qxal knows how to disguise the manifestations of their spellcasting to catch their foes off guard. If the next action they use is Casting a Spell that has a verbal component, they can remove the verbal component. This makes the spell quieter and allows them to cast it in areas where sound can't carry. Additionally, if Qxal has cover or greater cover against or is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} from one or more observers while Casting a Spell, they can attempt a @Check[stealth] check against one or more of those observers' Perception DC. If they succeed at their check against an observer's DC, that observer doesn't notice Qxal is casting a spell.

Woodland Stride.name: Woodland Stride
Woodland Stride.description: Qxal can pass freely through even the densest jungle. They ignore difficult terrain caused by plants, including plants manipulated by magic.

Cooperative Growth.name: Cooperative Growth
Cooperative Growth.description:
Requirements Qxal's last action was a successful Strike against a creature adjacent to a natural surface.

Effect Vines sprout from the surface, wrapping around the target's limbs. The creature gains the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} condition. To escape, the creature must succeed on a DC 28 Escape check or break the vines (AC 20, Hardness 4, HP 36, BT 18, weakness 10 to slashing).

Drain Life.name: Drain Life
Drain Life.description:
When the ragewight damages a living creature with its claw Strike, the ragewight gains 3 temporary Hit Points and the creature must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:18|options:inflicts:drained] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1}. Further damage dealt to the creature by the ragewight increases the amount of drain by 1 on a failed save, to a maximum of drained 4.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.LRIYUFQ7FE9H4RWD]{Effect: Drain Life}

Furious Grab.name: Furious Grab
Furious Grab.description:
Trigger A creature uses a move action to leave a square adjacent to the ragewight

Effect The ragewight attempts an Athletics check to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.PMbdMWc2QroouFGD]{Grapple} the target.

Rage.name: Rage
Rage.description:
The ragewight goes into a frenzy, gaining 8 temporary Hit Points. Its Strikes deal 2 additional damage, and it takes a -1 penalty to AC.

This lasts for 1 minute.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feat-effects.Item.z3uyCMBddrPK5umr]{Effect: Rage}

Wight Spawn.name: Wight Spawn
Wight Spawn.description: A living humanoid slain by a ragewight's claw Strike rises as a spawned wight after [[/gmr 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}. This spawned wight is under the command of the ragewight that killed it. It doesn't have the drain life or wight spawn abilities and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} for as long as it is a spawned wight. If the creator of the wight spawn dies, the wight spawn becomes a full-fledged, autonomous wight; it regains its free will, gains the drain life and wight spawn abilities, and is no longer clumsy.

After the Strike, the shark splashes back down into the water.

Guardian Construct Armor (Hardness 5).name: 守卫构装装甲 Guardian Construct Armor (硬度5)

和普通物品一样，活化守卫具有硬度。这种硬度可以减少与硬度相等的伤害。

一旦一个活化守卫的HP降低到一半以下，或者受到重击，其护甲立即被损坏，AC也会降低到13。它同时失去硬度。

Eruption.value:

效果 房间隆隆作响，一股热浪席卷区域内的每个生物，诱发其内心的恐惧。作祟启动，生物必须通过@Check[will|dc:18]豁免，而后作祟骰先攻。

大失败 生物惊惧2并@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.sDPxOjQ9kx2RZE8D]{逃跑 Fleeing}1轮。

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2}.

Critical Failure The creature is frightened 2 and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.sDPxOjQ9kx2RZE8D]{Fleeing} for 1 round.

Combat Grab.name: Combat Grab
Combat Grab.description:
Requirements The burned-out efreeti has one hand free

Effect The burned-out efreeti makes a melee Strike while keeping one hand free. If the Strike hits, the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} in the efreeti's free hand.

Burning Grasp.name: Burning Grasp
Burning Grasp.description: When the burned-out efreeti Grabs a creature, that creature takes @Damage[1d6[fire]] damage, then takes 1d6 fire damage at the end of each of its turns as long as it remains @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}.

Gunpowder Mastery.name: 火药精通 Gunpowder Mastery
Gunpowder Mastery.description: 由于步枪的射击功能已经无法修复，士兵们用他们的火药储备做出了爆炸箭，并且改造了枪械，使每次使用刺刀攻击命中时可以放出火焰。刺刀攻击大成功时，目标被点燃，受到[[/r 1d8[persistent,fire]]]伤害 (@Check[reflex|dc:21|traits:damaging-effect]豁免成功可取消)。

Trench Fighter.name: 堑壕战士 Trench Fighter

Saddleback Bunyip.name: Saddleback Bunyip
Saddleback Bunyip.publicNotes:
Bunyips are dangerous aquatic predators that resemble a cross between a shark and a seal. Found in freshwater inlets or saltwater coves worldwide, bunyips hunt where prey is plentiful, often to the consternation of coastal residents and fisherfolk。

Despite their outlandish appearance and tendency to defend their territory with loud, bellowing roars that echo for great distances, bunyips are very rarely sighted by humanoids, leaving many to question their existence. For hundreds of years, bunyips were widely regarded as nothing more than folk tales, and even now that their existence as a species has been proven, the existence of any particular bunyip in a local area is often met with heavy skepticism. While their limited shapechanging abilities are no doubt a significant part of the reason for this air of mystery, another major factor is that the aquatic creatures rarely hunt humanoids, preferring to eat smaller animals. Most bunyips avoid human contact, except when one wanders too close to their den or favorite hunting spot, at which point the territorial bunyip attacks with swift and terrible ferocity. Many scholars agree that a large number of unexplained disappearances near coastal areas are the result of unreported bunyip aggression。

In some ports, bunyips have learned that delicious prizes can be had from the chum and garbage discarded by fishing boats and merchant vessels. They lurk close to the shore and carefully choose their victims, plucking them off docks and small boats. These bunyips are particularly careful to keep their true forms hidden, but this does little to dull rumors of monster-infested waters。

Aquatic Opportunity.name: Aquatic Opportunity
Aquatic Opportunity.description: As @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.hFtNbo1LKYCoDy2O]{Attack of Opportunity}, but both the bunyip and the triggering creature must be in water.

Shift Form.name: Shift Form
Shift Form.description: A bunyip can alter its form slightly to gain an advantage and make it harder to recognize. When it does, its teeth shrink and its Jaws Strike doesn't deal the 1d6 persistent bleed damage. It can choose to gain either a long snake tail, granting its tail Strike reach 10 feet and Grab, or squat crocodile legs, increasing its land Speed to 20 feet. If it uses Shift Form again, the bunyip can return to normal or switch between a long tail or crocodile legs.

Blood Scent.name: Blood Scent
Blood Scent.description: The bunyip can smell blood in the water from up to 1 mile away.

Blood Frenzy.name: Blood Frenzy
Blood Frenzy.description:
Requirements The bunyip is not @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued} or already in a frenzy.

Trigger The bunyip deals bleed damage to a living creature.

Effect The bunyip flies into a frenzy that lasts 1 minute. While frenzied, the bunyip gains a +4 status bonus to damage rolls with its jaws, gains 8 temporary HP that go away at the end of the frenzy, and takes a -2 penalty to AC.

Roar.name: Roar
Roar.description: The bunyip lets out a loud and horrifying roar. Other creatures within 100 feet must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:21] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 3} on a critical failure, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1} on a success, or unaffected on a critical success). No matter the result, the creature is temporarily immune to the effect for 1 minute.

Scorched Cavern Troll.name: Scorched Cavern Troll
Scorched Cavern Troll.publicNotes:
Insatiable scavengers stalking the eternal gloom of the Darklands, cavern trolls consume all in their path-even rocks and minerals when more nourishing sustenance is scarce. These rocky goliaths can tunnel through stone with their iron-sharp claws。

Cavern trolls rarely venture to the surface world, for they have a debilitating vulnerability to sunlight that petrifies them on sustained contact. Unlike common trolls, cavern trolls can regenerate wounds dealt by fire. The crystalline nature of their skin, however, permits sonic attacks to neutralize their signature regeneration。

As cavern trolls age, their flinty skin becomes studded with small crystals and stones of various composition. Paragons of their kind have toothy maws replete with large, crystalline fangs. A typical cavern troll stands 14 feet in height and weighs about 2,000 pounds。

Rock Tunneler.name: Rock Tunneler
Rock Tunneler.description: A cavern troll can burrow through solid stone at a Speed of 10 feet. It can leave a tunnel if it desires.

Sunlight Petrification.name: Sunlight Petrification
Sunlight Petrification.description: If exposed to direct sunlight, a cavern troll immediately becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} and can't use reactions or Trample. The slowed value increases by 1 each time the cavern troll ends its turn in sunlight. If the cavern troll's actions are reduced to 0 in this way, they become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dTwPJuKgBQCMxixg]{Petrified} until they spends at least 1 minute in darkness. Spells like @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.a3aQxCpoj1q1NQxC]{Sunburst} that create magical sunlight cannot petrify a cavern troll, but the troll is slowed 1 for [[/gmr 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds} after being exposed to such an effect.

Scorched Earth Mephit.name: 焦土魔蝠 Scorched Earth Mephit

Breath Weapon.name: 吐息 Breath Weapon
Breath Weapon.description:
焦土魔蝠对@Template[cone|distance:15]范围内的生物喷吐熔岩，造成@Damage[2d4[fire]]伤害和[[/r 1d4[persistent,fire]]] (@Check[reflex|dc:17|basic]豁免)。

焦土魔蝠在[[/gmr 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4轮}内无法再次使用吐息。

Magma Swim.name: 熔岩泳者 Magma Swim
Magma Swim.description: 焦土魔蝠的游泳速度只在岩浆或熔岩中起效。

Hamstring.name: Hamstring
Hamstring.description:
Frequency once per round

The Scorched Earth clipper makes a melee Strike, attempting to sever connective tissues and disable its foe. If it hits, in addition to taking @Damage[(1d6+8)[slashing]] damage, the creature must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:20] save, with the following effects.

Success The creature is unaffected.

Failure The creature is off-guard and takes a -5 foot status penalty to its movement until the end of its next turn.

Critical Failure As failure, and the creature is knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.

Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description: Scorched Earth orcs deal an extra 2d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

Hunt Prey.name: Hunt Prey
Hunt Prey.description: The Scorched Earth scout designates a single creature they can see and hear, or one they're Tracking, as their prey. The Scorched Earth scout gains a +2 circumstance bonus to Perception checks to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.BlAOM2X92SI6HMtJ]{Seek} the prey and to Survival checks to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.EA5vuSgJfiHH7plD]{Track} the prey. The first time the Scorched Earth scout hits the designated prey in a round, they deal an additional 1d8 precision damage. The Scorched Earth scout also ignores the penalty for making ranged attacks within their second range increment. These effects last until the Scorched Earth scout uses Hunt Prey again.

Tethered Shot.name: Tethered Shot
Tethered Shot.description:
Frequency once per round

The Scorched Earth sharpshooter makes a ranged Strike, firing an arrow attached to a line at a creature in range.

If it hits, in addition to taking @Damage[(1d8+4)[piercing]] damage, that creature must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:20] save, with the following effects.

Success The creature is unaffected.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} for 1 minute or until it @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escapes}(DC 20).

Critical Failure As failure, but the creature is pulled 5 feet toward the sharpshooter.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} for 1 minute or until it [[/act escape dc=23]]{Escapes}.

Critical Failure As failure, but the creature is pulled 5 feet toward the sharpshooter.

Blood Frenzy.name: Blood Frenzy
Blood Frenzy.description:
Requirements The sea devil is not @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued} or already in a frenzy

Trigger The sea devil deals bleed damage to a living creature.

Effect The sea devil flies into a frenzy that lasts 1 minute. While frenzied, the sea devil gains a +1 status bonus to attack rolls with its claws and jaws, gains a +4 status bonus to damage rolls with its claws and jaws, gains 11 temporary HP until the end of the frenzy, and takes a -2 status penalty to AC. The sea devil can't voluntarily stop its frenzy. After its frenzy, the sea devil is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued}.

Bloodletting.name: Bloodletting
Bloodletting.description: When the sea devil deals piercing or slashing damage, it also deals @Damage[1d4[bleed]] if the target was @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} or if the attack was a critical hit.

Reel In.name: Reel In
Reel In.description:
The sea devil impaler pulls the rope attached to their barbed trident 10 feet closer on a success (20 feet on a critical success).

Athletics check vs. Fortitude DC.

Skewer.name: Skewer
Skewer.description: When the sea devil hits with their barbed trident, the creature becomes skewered. The trident can be removed with an Interact action by succeeding at a @Check[athletics|dc:21] check to pull it free.

Shark Commune 150 feet.description: The sea devil can communicate telepathically with sharks within range. It can communicate only simple concepts like "come," "guard," or "attack."
Shark Commune 150 feet.name: Shark Commune 150 feet

equipment-Barbed Trident (tied to 50 fee.name: Barbed Trident (tied to 50 feet of rope)
equipment-Barbed Trident (tied to 50 fee.description: This three-pronged, spear-like weapon typically has a 4-foot shaft. Like a spear, it can be wielded with one hand or thrown.

Unimpeded Throw.name: Unimpeded Throw
Unimpeded Throw.description: A sea devil impaler can use thrown ranged weapons underwater with no penalty due to range increment.

equipment-Russian Imperial Army uniform.name: 俄罗斯帝国军装 Russian Imperial Army uniform

equipment-Junk Mosin-Nagant rifle with a.name: 装有刺刀的莫辛纳甘步枪(损坏,无法开火) Junk Mosin-Nagant rifle with attached bayonet (can't fire)

Davai!.name: 集火！ Davai!
Davai!.description:
塞米恩命令他的部下集火一个他能看到的目标。所有能听到或看到他的盟友对该生物的攻击和伤害骰获得+1状态加值，直到塞米恩下回合开始。

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.uqjx1bwYduHwwC7d]{效果：集火！}

Gunpowder Mastery.name: 火药精通 Gunpowder Mastery
Gunpowder Mastery.description: 由于步枪的射击功能已经无法修复，士兵们用他们的火药储备做出了爆炸箭，并且改造了枪械，使每次使用刺刀攻击命中时可以放出火焰。刺刀攻击大成功时，目标被点燃，受到[[/r 1d8[persistent,fire]]]伤害 (@Check[reflex|dc:21|traits:damaging-effect]豁免成功可取消)。

Trench Fighter.name: 堑壕战士 Trench Fighter
Trench Fighter.description: 俄罗斯士兵受过完善的训练，善于利用掩体。他们的AC从高级掩蔽中获得+5的环境加值，从标准掩蔽中获得+3的环境加值，而非+4和+2。

Sezruth (1-2).name: Sezruth (1-2)
Sezruth (1-2).allSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

Empowered Blood.name: Empowered Blood
Empowered Blood.description:
The Usij cultists' blood magic strengthens Sezruth. He begins with 2 Blood Points from sacrifices just before the PCs arrived, and gains 1 additional Blood Point for each time the empowered blood hazard is activated in area B. The adjustments are not cumulative.

1-2 Blood Points Sezruth gains 5 temporary Hit Points.

3-4 Blood Points Sezruth gains 5 temporary Hit Points. Sezruth is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{Quickened 1} and can use the extra action to Stride toward or Strike the foe it is aware of with the highest Charisma score.

5 or more Blood Points Sezruth gains 10 temporary Hit Points. Sezruth is quickened 1 and can use the extra action to Stride toward or Strike the foe it is aware of with the highest Charisma score

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Hatred of Beauty.name: Hatred of Beauty
Hatred of Beauty.description: While aghashes hate all mortals, they particularly despise beautiful objects and beautiful or charismatic mortals. When not in physical peril, an aghash is compelled to destroy art and other works of beauty. An aghash can't enter an area of pristine beauty without first marring it in some way. Given a choice, an aghash attacks a foe with the highest Charisma score first. If barred from doing so by force or some magical effect, they take @Damage[1d6[mental]] damage at the end of their turn

Cursed Gaze.name: Cursed Gaze
Cursed Gaze.description:
The aghash fixes their gaze on one creature they can see within 20 feet. The creature must attempt a @Check[will|dc:19|name:Curse Gaze] save

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes @Damage[2d4[mental]] damage and becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}.

Failure The creature takes @Damage[4d4[mental]] damage and becomes either @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1} (the aghash's choice).

Critical Failure The creature takes @Damage[8d4[mental]] damage and becomes Frightened 2 and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 2}.

Sandstorm.name: Sandstorm
Sandstorm.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect The aghash creates a temporary sandstorm in a @Template[emanation|distance:30] that lasts for 5 rounds. Creatures within the emanation take a –4 circumstance penalty to Perception checks and must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:17|options:area-effect] save. On a failure, they're forced to hold their breath or else they start suffocating. A creature within the sandstorm at the end of its turn takes @Damage[1d4[slashing]|options:area-damage] damage. Divs are immune to all effects of an aghash's sandstorm.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.f8rncEs06bqcn3LZ]{Effect: Sandstorm}
