Curse of the Spiraling Maelstrom.name: Curse of the Spiraling Maelstrom
Curse of the Spiraling Maelstrom.description:
Trigger A creature adjacent to Silaqui successfully hits her with a Strike.

Effect The attacker takes @Damage[1d6[slashing]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:20|basic] save) as they are battered by high-pressure water currents.

Curse of the Spiraling Maelstrom.name: Curse of the Spiraling Maelstrom
Curse of the Spiraling Maelstrom.description:
Trigger A creature adjacent to Silaqui successfully hits her with a Strike.

Effect The attacker takes @Damage[2d6[slashing]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:22|basic] save) as they are battered by high-pressure water currents.

Sinkhole.name: Sinkhole
Sinkhole.disable: @Check[nature|dc:12|name:Uncover Sinkhole|traits:environmental] to remove the covering foliage
Sinkhole.hazarddescription: An assortment of leaves and loose dirt cover a sudden drop in elevation。

Fall.name: Fall
Fall.description:
Trigger A creature walks onto the sinkhole

Effect The triggering creature falls in and takes falling damage (@Damage[10[bludgeoning]|options:fall-damage] damage). That creature can use the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.3yoajuKjwHZ9ApUY]{Grab an Edge} reaction to avoid falling.

Skeletal Cyclops.name: 骷髅独眼巨人 Skeletal Cyclops

equipment-Long Bone.name: 长骨 Long Bone
equipment-Long Bone.description:
功能如长棒。

这根粗壮而纤细的棍子末端呈锥形，平衡良好。它被设计成一种攻守兼备的武器。

Broad Swipe.name: 广域横扫 Broad Swipe
Broad Swipe.description: 巨人使用长棒对触及范围内的两名敌人各发动一次打击。在这两次攻击完成前多重攻击减值不会增加。

Explosive Death.name: 爆炸性死亡 Explosive Death
Explosive Death.description: 当骷髅被摧毁时，它的骨头会破碎然后爆炸，和支撑它的死灵能量一并放射出去。相邻的生物受到@Damage[2d6[slashing]]伤害，@Check[reflex|dc:17|basic]豁免。

Terrifying Charge.name: 恐怖冲锋 Terrifying Charge
Terrifying Charge.description: 巨人行进并且使用爪抓打击，这次爪抓打击在伤害上拥有+4环境加值。如果打击命中，巨人对目标尝试一次@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.action-macros.Macro.nEwqNNWX6scLt4sc]{挫败士气}。

Sliding Statue (1-2).name: Sliding Statue (1-2)
Sliding Statue (1-2).disable: @Check[athletics|dc:20|name:Hold Back Statue|traits:complex,hazard,magical,trap] to hold it back, @Check[crafting|dc:17|name:Break Statue|traits:complex,hazard,magical,trap] (受训) to break the statue by exploiting a flaw, @Check[occultism|dc:16|name:Dispel Planar Energies|traits:complex,hazard,magical,trap] (受训) to dispel the planar energies。
Sliding Statue (1-2).hazarddescription: With a rumble, this statue of a former Pathfinder slides across the schoolyard. Its legs pump up and down as it advances。
Sliding Statue (1-2).routine: (3 actions) The trap uses its three actions for its Trample activity。

Slide.name: Slide
Slide.description:
触发 A creature approaches within 10 feet of the trap。

效果 The statue Strides up to 30 feet in the direction of the triggering creature. It deals [[/r {1d6+3}]]{1d6+3伤害} (@Check[reflex|dc:17|basic|traits:complex,hazard,magical,trap] save) to each creature whose space it enters。

Sliding Statue (3-4).name: Sliding Statue (3-4)
Sliding Statue (3-4).disable: @Check[athletics|dc:23|name:Hold Back Statue|traits:complex,hazard,magical,trap] to hold it back, @Check[crafting|dc:20|name:Break Statue|traits:complex,hazard,magical,trap] (受训) to break the statue by exploiting a flaw, @Check[occultism|dc:18|name:Dispel Planar Energies|traits:complex,hazard,magical,trap] (受训) to dispel the planar energies。
Sliding Statue (3-4).hazarddescription: With a rumble, this statue of a former Pathfinder slides across the schoolyard. Its legs pump up and down as it advances。
Sliding Statue (3-4).routine: (3 actions) The trap uses its three actions for its Trample activity。

Slide.name: Slide
Slide.description:
触发 A creature approaches within 10 feet of the trap。

效果 The statue Strides up to 30 feet in the direction of the triggering creature. It deals [[/r {1d10+6}]]{1d10+6伤害} (@Check[reflex|dc:20|basic|traits:complex,hazard,magical,trap] save) to each creature whose space it enters。

Small Opossum.name: Small Opossum
Small Opossum.allSaves: +2 circumstance to all saves vs. disease

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Disease.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Disease

Feign Death.name: Feign Death
Feign Death.description:
Trigger The opossum is reduced below 15 HP

Effect The opossum collapses. It is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} and can use actions that require only its mind, but any other action ends the ruse. A successful @Check[perception|dc:16|name:See Through Feign Death|traits:action:seek] check to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.BlAOM2X92SI6HMtJ]{Seek} or @Check[medicine|dc:16|name:See Through Feign Death|traits:action:recall-knowledge] check to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.1OagaWtBpVXExToo]{Recall Knowledge} is required to determine that the animal is not, in fact, dead.

Revived Retaliation.name: Revived Retaliation
Revived Retaliation.description:
Trigger The opossum is attacked or disturbed by a creature within reach while Feigning Death

Effect The opossum Strikes the triggering creature.

Scurry Underfoot.name: Scurry Underfoot
Scurry Underfoot.description: The opossum Strides up to half its speed. It can pass through other creatures' spaces during this movement, though it must end its movement in an unoccupied space.

Smoldering Moss Monster.name: 阴燃苔藓怪 Smoldering Moss Monster

strike-Flaming Peat Ball.name: 燃烧泥炭球 Flaming Peat Ball

Smoldering Stench.name: 阴燃臭气 Smoldering Stench
Smoldering Stench.description:
@Template[emanation|distance:5]{5尺} @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.v61oEQaDdcRpaZ9X]{灵光}

进入灵光范围或在灵光中开始回合的生物必须进行@Check[fortitude|dc:17]豁免。

成功 该生物不受影响，并暂时免疫阴燃臭气1分钟。

失败 生物@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{恶心 Sickened 1}。

大失败 生物@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{恶心 Sickened 2}。

Bardic Lore.name: Bardic Lore
Bardic Lore.description: Solvatar can Recall Knowledge on any subject with a +7 modifier.

Sonic Redirection.name: Sonic Redirection
Sonic Redirection.description:
Trigger The spark troll would take sonic damage

Effect The spark troll redirects hazardous sonic vibrations to another target within 30 feet. The spark troll gains resistance 5 against the triggering damage, and their chosen target must succeed at a @Check[reflex|dc:16] save or be knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.

Lightning Blast.description: The spark troll calls lightning down from the sky, then redirects it out from their hands in a @Template[line|distance:40]. Creatures in the line take @Damage[1d4[electricity]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:16|basic|options:area-effect] save).
Lightning Blast.name: Lightning Blast
Lightning Blast
Lightning Blast.description: The spark troll calls lightning down from the sky, then redirects it out from their hands in a @Template[line|distance:40]. Creatures in the line take @Damage[2d4[electricity]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:17|basic|options:area-effect] save).

Sonic Redirection.description:
Trigger The spark troll would take sonic damage

Effect The spark troll redirects hazardous sonic vibrations to another target within 30 feet. The spark troll gains resistance 5 against the triggering damage, and their chosen target must succeed at a @Check[reflex|dc:17] save or be knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.

Natural Camouflage.name: Natural Camouflage
Natural Camouflage.description: Ssalarn's white and blue scales provide natural camouflage. In areas of snow and ice, Ssalarn can move at his full Speed when Sneaking, and he gains a +4 circumstance bonus to Hide.

Gelid Breath.name: Gelid Breath
Gelid Breath.description:
The tatzlwyrm belches a puff of frigid vapor into the face of an adjacent creature, which must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:15|traits:damaging-effect] save; the creature takes a -2 circumstance penalty to this save if it's @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard}. The tatzlwyrm can't use Gelid Breath again for 2 rounds.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} for 1 round.

Failure The target takes @Damage[2d6[cold]] damage and is clumsy 1 for 1 round.

Critical Failure The target takes @Damage[4d6[cold]] damage and is clumsy 1 for 1 minute.

Electrified Blood.name: Electrified Blood
Electrified Blood.description:
Trigger An adjacent creature deals piercing or slashing damage to the sea drake

Effect An arc of electricity courses through the sea drake's blood. The triggering creature takes @Damage[1d6[electricity]] damage.

Ball Lightning Breath.name: Ball Lightning Breath
Ball Lightning Breath.description:
The sea drake spews a ball of electricity that strikes a primary target within 100 feet, dealing @Damage[6d6[electricity]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:22|basic] save). The lightning then arcs to up to three secondary targets within 30 feet of the primary target, striking the closest available targets first. The secondary bolts each strike one secondary target and deal the same rolled damage value as the primary bolt (@Check[reflex|dc:20|basic] save).

The sea drake can't use Ball Lightning Breath again for [[/gmr 1d6 #Recharge Ball Lightning Breath]]{1d6 rounds}.

Briny Wound.name: Briny Wound
Briny Wound.description:
A sea drake's saliva carries a large quantity of salt, making its bite wounds even more painful. When a creature takes damage from a sea drake's jaws Strike, the creature must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:22] save; the creature is then temporarily immune to briny wound for 1 minute.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2}.

Critical Failure The creature is Sickened 2 and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} as long as it's sickened.

Draconic Frenzy.name: Draconic Frenzy
Draconic Frenzy.description: The sea drake makes one jaws Strike and two tail Strikes in any order.

Sticky Web Lurker Noose.name: Sticky Web Lurker Noose
Sticky Web Lurker Noose.disable: @Check[survival|dc:20] (受训) or @Check[thievery|dc:20] (专家) to rearrange the webbing。
Sticky Web Lurker Noose.hazarddescription: Discreet webbing at throat level snags a creature that walks into it。

Web Noose.name: Web Noose
Web Noose.description:
Trigger A creature steps into the square with the web tripwire.

Effect The web lurker noose makes a noose Strike against the triggering creature.

Storasta's Last Stand (3-4).name: Storasta's Last Stand (3-4)
Storasta's Last Stand (3-4).disable: @Check[deception|dc:22] to appear to be a defender of Storasta, @Check[diplomacy|dc:22] to demonstrate benign intentions, or @Check[occultism|dc:20]或@Check[religion|dc:20] to ward off the malevolent spiritual energies. Two successful checks are required to disable the haunt, and each attempt requires two actions。
Storasta's Last Stand (3-4).hazarddescription: A ghostly host of god callers and their eidolons manifests to defend the barrow against intruders, and the strains of a battle song fill the air。
Storasta's Last Stand (3-4).reset: The haunt dissipates 1 minute after all living creatures leave area C1. Its spiritual energies re-form after 24 hours。
Storasta's Last Stand (3-4).routine: (1动作) (illusion, mental, occult) The haunt attacks what it believes is a demonic incursion, dealing [[/r {(1d8+3)[mental],1d8[good]}]]{1d8+3 mental and 1d8 good伤害} to each living creature in the area (@Check[will|dc:21|basic|name:Storasta's Last Stand|traits:illusion,mental,occult]豁免)。

Hold The Line.name: Hold The Line
Hold The Line.description:
Trigger One or more living creatures attempts to move past the entryway further into the barrow

Effect Each creature in the area feels their own form warping into that of a hideous demon and must attempt a @Check[will|dc:21] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected by the onslaught of illusions.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1}.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} and believes that it is infused with demonic energy, making it susceptible to holy effects (even if it is not unholy) for as long as it remains within the haunt's area.

Critical Failure As failure, but the creature also gains weakness 5 to cold iron for the next 24 hours.

Storasta's Last Stand (5-6).name: Storasta's Last Stand (5-6)
Storasta's Last Stand (5-6).disable: @Check[deception|dc:25] to appear to be a defender of Storasta, @Check[diplomacy|dc:25] to demonstrate benign intentions, or @Check[occultism|dc:22]或@Check[religion|dc:22] to ward off the malevolent spiritual energies. Two successful checks are required to disable the haunt, and each attempt requires two actions。
Storasta's Last Stand (5-6).hazarddescription: A ghostly host of god callers and their eidolons manifests to defend the barrow against intruders, and the strains of a battle song fill the air。
Storasta's Last Stand (5-6).reset: The haunt dissipates 1 minute after all living creatures leave area C1. Its spiritual energies re-form after 24 hours。
Storasta's Last Stand (5-6).routine: (1动作) (illusion, mental, occult) The haunt attacks what it believes is a demonic incursion, dealing @Damage[(1d8+9)[mental]]伤害和@Damage[1d8[good]]伤害(@Check[will|dc:24|basic|name:Storasta's Last Stand]豁免)。

Hold The Line.name: Hold The Line
Hold The Line.description:
Trigger One or more living creatures attempts to move past the entryway further into the barrow

Effect Each creature in the area feels their own form warping into that of a hideous demon and must attempt a @Check[will|dc:24] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected by the onslaught of illusions.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1}.

Critical Failure As failure, but the creature also gains weakness 5 to cold iron for the next 24 hours.

Consume Lightning.name: Consume Lightning
Consume Lightning.description:
Trigger The storm bear is targeted by, or in the area of, an effect that deals electricity damage

Effect The storm bear devours some of the electricity to fuel a quick burst of speed, becoming @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{Quickened} for 1 round. While quickened, the storm bear's motions produce visible sparks of electricity.

Thunderous Roar.name: Thunderous Roar
Thunderous Roar.description:
The storm bear unleashes a deafening roar. Any non-storm bear creature within 10 feet takes @Damage[2d6[sonic]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:17|basic] save); creatures that critically fail this save are deafened for [[/gmr 1d6 #rounds]]{1d6 rounds}.

The storm bear can't use Thunderous Roar again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Thunderous Roar]]{1d4 rounds}.

Consume Lightning.name: Consume Lightning
Consume Lightning.description:
Trigger The storm bear is targeted by, or in the area of, an effect that deals electricity damage

Effect The storm bear devours some of the electricity to fuel a quick burst of speed, becoming @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{Quickened} for 1 round. While quickened, the storm bear's motions produce visible sparks of electricity.

Thunderous Roar.name: Thunderous Roar
Thunderous Roar.description:
The storm bear unleashes a deafening roar. Any non-storm bear creature within 10 feet takes @Damage[2d10[sonic]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:19|basic] save); creatures that critically fail this save are deafened for [[/gmr 1d6 #rounds]]{1d6 rounds}.

The storm bear can't use Thunderous Roar again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Thunderous Roar]]{1d4 rounds}.

Infused Items.name: Infused Items
Infused Items.description: Strak carries the following infused items, which last for 24 hours, or until the next time he makes his daily preparations: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.TZUskLT7yvP7N2co]{Elixir of Life (Lesser)}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.SgtqZxt26BdjUmEB]{Acid Flask (Moderate)}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.gWr4q4HiyGhETA8H]{Alchemist's Fire (Moderate)} (9), and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.ehss8yPTXxiUdVlJ]{Smokestick (Greater)}.

Quick Bomber.name: Quick Bomber
Quick Bomber.description: Strak draws an alchemical bomb with an Interact action and throws it as a ranged Strike.

Infused Items.name: Infused Items
Infused Items.description: Strak carries the following infused items, which last for 24 hours, or until the next time he makes his daily preparations:@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.TZUskLT7yvP7N2co]{Elixir of Life (Lesser)}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.SgtqZxt26BdjUmEB]{Acid Flask (Moderate)}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.gWr4q4HiyGhETA8H]{Alchemist's Fire (Moderate)} (12), and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.ehss8yPTXxiUdVlJ]{Smokestick (Greater)}.

Directional Bombs.name: Directional Bombs
Directional Bombs.description: When throwing an alchemical bomb with the splash trait, Strak can treat the target's space as the first affected square of a @Template[cone|distance:15] directed away from him, potentially allowing him to avoid allies and splash deeper into enemy lines. If the target takes up more than a single square, the target's square closest to Strak is the first affected square of the cone.

Quick Bomber.name: Quick Bomber
Quick Bomber.description: Strak draws an alchemical bomb with an Interact action and throws it as a ranged Strike.

Stranded Melody (5-6).name: Stranded Melody (5-6)
Stranded Melody (5-6).disable: @Check[performance|dc:24|name:Duplicate the Melody|traits:environmental,magical] (专家) twice to duplicate the melody and appease the elemental, or @Check[arcana|dc:27|name:Guide the Elemental|traits:environmental,magical] (专家) and then @Check[diplomacy|dc:24|name:Guide the Elemental|traits:environmental,magical] (受训) to guide the elemental through a planar tear elsewhere in the manor. Each attempt to Disable the hazard requires two actions, and each successful check to Disable removes one action from the hazard's routine。
Stranded Melody (5-6).hazarddescription: Planar winds summoned from beyond sweep through the room, song and sound carried adrift on their current. This air elemental is trapped on the Material Plane and can't escape。
Stranded Melody (5-6).reset: The melody remains for 1 minute, after which it disperses into several holes in the walls. It returns after an hour unless disabled。
Stranded Melody (5-6).routine: (2 actions) For each action in the routine, the melody makes a solid refrain Strike against one creature in its area. This trap doesn't take a multiple attack penalty。

Opening Melody.name: Opening Melody
Opening Melody.description:
Trigger A creature enters area B3

Effect Winds surge into the room. The hazard rolls initiative.

Mesmerizing Duet.name: Mesmerizing Duet
Mesmerizing Duet.description:
When a creature fails a Performance check to Disable the melody, the elemental plays along before taking over the performance. Creatures in the area must attempt a @Check[will|dc:22] save to resist becoming fascinated by the melody.

Regardless of the result of the saving throw, the creature is then temporarily immune to Mesmerising Duet for 1 hour.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} for 1 round.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AdPVz7rbaVSRxHFg]{Fascinated} for 1 round; this fascination does not end when the creature or its allies take damage from the hazard.

Critical Failure The creature is fascinated for [[/gmr 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}; this fascination does not end when the creature or its allies take damage from the hazard.

Stranded Melody (7-8).name: Stranded Melody (7-8)
Stranded Melody (7-8).disable: @Check[performance|dc:27|name:Duplicate the Melody|traits:environmental,magical] (专家) twice to duplicate the melody and appease the elemental, or @Check[arcana|dc:30|name:Guide the Elemental|traits:environmental,magical] (专家) and then @Check[diplomacy|dc:27|name:Guide the Elemental|traits:environmental,magical] (受训) to guide the elemental through a planar tear elsewhere in the manor. Invigorating Agony.name: Invigorating Agony
Invigorating Agony.description:
Requirements Teflar has spent at least 1 Focus Point

Trigger Teflar takes bleed, piercing, or slashing damage

Effect Teflar regains 1 Focus Point

Guide's Warning.name: Guide's Warning
Guide's Warning.description:
Trigger Tewakam is about to roll a Perception or Survival check to determine his initiative

Effect Tewakam visually or audibly warns allies, granting them a +1 circumstance bonus to their initiative rolls. Depending on how Tewakam warns allies, this action has the auditory or visual trait.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.UiISDbCjK6AUDsll]{Effect: Guide's Warning}

Guiding Words.name: Guiding Words
Guiding Words.description:
Tewakam points out a weakness of a creature within 30 feet. Tewakam and all allies that can hear or see him gain a +1 status bonus to attack and damage rolls against that creature until the beginning of Tewakam's next turn. Tewakam adds an extra 1d4 precision damage to his weapon and unarmed attacks that hit that creature during the duration.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.uqjx1bwYduHwwC7d]{Effect: Guiding Words}

equipment-Scalpel.name: Scalpel
equipment-Scalpel.description: This small, bladed weapon is held in one hand and used to stab a creature in close combat. It can also be thrown.

Bloodletting.name: Bloodletting
Bloodletting.description: When the sea devil deals piercing or slashing damage, it also deals @Damage[1d4[bleed]] if the target was @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} or if the attack was a critical hit.

Sneak Attack.description: The saboteur deals an extra 2d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.
Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack

Surprise Attack.name: Surprise Attack
Surprise Attack.description: On the first round of combat, if the saboteur rolls Deception or Stealth for initiative, creatures that haven't acted are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to them.

Odru: Wind and Wavesense.name: Odru: Wind and Wavesense
Odru: Wind and Wavesense.description: Odru's faith extends her wavesense to a range of 60 feet and allows it to function equally well in clouds of water droplets or vapor, such as mist. (Odru only.)

Shark Commune 150 feet.name: Shark Commune 150 feet
Shark Commune 150 feet.description: The sea devil can communicate telepathically with sharks within range. It can communicate only simple concepts like "come," "guard," or "attack."

Sythi: Nervous Retreat.name: Sythi: Nervous Retreat
Sythi: Nervous Retreat.description:
Trigger An ally ends a move action adjacent to Sythi.

Effect Sythi hides behind his ally. He Steps to another square adjacent to the triggering ally and gains a +2 circumstance bonus to his AC against the next attack that targets him. (Sythi only.)

Blood Frenzy.name: Blood Frenzy
Blood Frenzy.description:
Requirements The sea devil is not @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued} or already in a frenzy

Trigger The sea devil deals bleed damage to a living creature.

Effect The sea devil flies into a frenzy that lasts 1 minute. While frenzied, the sea devil gains a +1 status bonus to attack rolls with its claws and jaws, gains a +4 status bonus to damage rolls with its claws and jaws, gains 15 temporary HP until the end of the frenzy, and takes a -2 status penalty to AC. The sea devil can't voluntarily stop its frenzy. After its frenzy, the sea devil is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued}.

Rahla: Applied Anesthesia.name: Rahla: Applied Anesthesia
Rahla: Applied Anesthesia.description: Rahla's scalpel is coated with a disorienting agent. The first creature she successfully hits with a scalpel strike must succeed on a @Check[fortitude|dc:22|traits:poison] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}; this is a poison effect. (Rahla only.)

The Scholar of Sorts (1-2).name: The Scholar of Sorts (1-2)
The Scholar of Sorts (1-2).publicNotes:
Akizendris gnaw at sources of knowledge and lore, gleefully corrupting and altering them to vex scholars and sages across the planes with contradictions and untruths. These proteans appear as cackling, serpentine creatures with elongated crocodilian faces, luminous eyes, and arms that vanish at the elbows into swirling clouds of runes before reforming into solid talons。

Akizendris amuse themselves by rearranging or deleting texts, placing insulting acrostics in poetic verses, and penning crude insults upon title pages. Libraries in such places as Heaven, Axis, and Hell are especially keen to avoid such contamination, knowing that their records are choice targets for every akizendri in existence。

Text Immersion.name: Text Immersion
Text Immersion.description:
When the Scholar casts @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.VVAZPCvd4d90qVA1]{Secret Page}, it can physically immerse itself in the text, changing the message of the text in the process. It can exit the book at any point by Dismissing secret page, at which point it appears in a space adjacent to the text. If it does so to begin combat, it rolls a Deception check for initiative.

As long as it remains immersed in the text, the Scholar has no body. It can communicate telepathically with a creature as long as the creature touches the book or scroll that contains the secret page. It can sense nearby creatures using its entropy sense, but not in any other way, nor can it use any attack, manipulate, or move actions or speak aloud. If the object they are immersed in is destroyed, the Scholar reappears in an adjacent square and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1}.

Text Passage.name: Text Passage
Text Passage.description:
Requirements The Scholar is adjacent to a text they have modified with @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.VVAZPCvd4d90qVA1]{Secret Page}, and another such text is within 500 feet

Effect The Scholar has a way with words beyond other akizendris. They physically immerse themself into the adjacent text, which they use as a medium to teleport to another text within 500 feet that they have modified with secret page. Once they enter the first text, they instantly know the locations of the other texts within range.

Entering a text in this manner automatically dispels the secret page effect on it, but not the secret page effect on the destination text. The locations of the Scholar's modified texts are marked on the map.

Entropy Sense (Imprecise) 30 feet.name: Entropy Sense (Imprecise) 30 feet
Entropy Sense (Imprecise) 30 feet.description: An akizendri can anticipate the most likely location of a creature through their supernatural insight into the forces of chaotic probabilities and chance. This grants the Scholar the ability to sense creatures within the listed range. A creature under the effects of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.EoKBlgf6Smt8opaU]{Veil of Privacy} or that is otherwise shielded from divinations and predictions cannot be noticed via entropy sense.

Protean Anatomy 6.name: Protean Anatomy 6
Protean Anatomy 6.description:
An akizendri's vital organs shift and change shape and position constantly. Immediately after the Scholar takes acid, electricity, or sonic damage, it gains the listed amount of resistance to that damage type. This lasts for 1 hour or until the next time the protean takes damage of one of the other types (in which case its resistance changes to match that type), whichever comes first.

The Scholar is immune to polymorph effects unless they are a willing target. If @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.9PR9y0bi4JPKnHPR]{Deafened}, the Scholar automatically recovers at the end of its next turn as new sensory organs grow to replace the compromised ones.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.c6SiBB3mzV8lZUQr]{Effect: Protean Anatomy}

Change Shape.name: Change Shape
Change Shape.description:
The Scholar takes on the appearance of any Small or smaller creature. This doesn't change its Speed or its attack and damage bonuses with its Strikes, but might change the damage type its Strikes deal.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

Garbled Thoughts.name: Garbled Thoughts
Garbled Thoughts.description:
A creature hit by the Scholar's bite Strike must attempt a @Check[will|dc:20] save.

Success The creature is unaffected.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} for [[/gmr 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.

Critical Failure As failure, but the creature is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} for 1 round.

The Scholar of Sorts (3-4).name: The Scholar of Sorts (3-4)
The Scholar of Sorts (3-4).publicNotes:
Akizendris gnaw at sources of knowledge and lore, gleefully corrupting and altering them to vex scholars and sages across the planes with contradictions and untruths. These proteans appear as cackling, serpentine creatures with elongated crocodilian faces, luminous eyes, and arms that vanish at the elbows into swirling clouds of runes before reforming into solid talons。

Akizendris amuse themselves by rearranging or deleting texts, placing insulting acrostics in poetic verses, and penning crude insults upon title pages. Libraries in such places as Heaven, Axis, and Hell are especially keen to avoid such contamination, knowing that their records are choice targets for every akizendri in existence。

Entropy Sense (Imprecise) 30 feet.name: Entropy Sense (Imprecise) 30 feet
Entropy Sense (Imprecise) 30 feet.description: An akizendri can anticipate the most likely location of a creature through their supernatural insight into the forces of chaotic probabilities and chance. This grants the Scholar the ability to sense creatures within the listed range. A creature under the effects of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.EoKBlgf6Smt8opaU]{Veil of Privacy} or that is otherwise shielded from divinations and predictions cannot be noticed via entropy sense.

Text Immersion.name: Text Immersion
Text Immersion.description:
When the Scholar casts @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.VVAZPCvd4d90qVA1]{Secret Page}, it can physically immerse itself in the text, changing the message of the text in the process. It can exit the book at any point by Dismissing secret page, at which point it appears in a space adjacent to the text. If it does so to begin combat, it rolls a Deception check for initiative.

As long as it remains immersed in the text, the Scholar has no body. It can communicate telepathically with a creature as long as the creature touches the book or scroll that contains the secret page. It can sense nearby creatures using its entropy sense, but not in any other way, nor can it use any attack, manipulate, or move actions or speak aloud. If the object they are immersed in is destroyed, the Scholar reappears in an adjacent square and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1}.

Critical Failure As failure, but the creature is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} for 1 round.

Tough Leaded Skeleton.name: 强壮覆铅骷髅 Tough Leaded Skeleton

strike-Leaded Bone-fused Hammer.name: 融合在骨头上的覆铅锤子 Leaded Bone-fused Hammer

Lead Cloud.name: 铅云 Lead Cloud
Lead Cloud.description:
触发 覆铅骷髅被近战攻击命中；

效果 释放出一团铅云，在骷髅周围形成一团@Template[burst|distance:5]{5尺半径}的微粒。铅云持续1轮，使其中的生物暴露在吸入式的迅猛铅毒中。

Rapid Lead Poison.name: 迅猛铅毒 Rapid Lead Poison
Rapid Lead Poison.description:
大量的铅会造成头痛、难以集中注意力和关节疼痛。死灵魔法增强了骷髅表面的铅，使之生效速度远远快于一般的铅中毒。

豁免检定 @Check[fortitude|dc:20]

最大持续时间 4轮

阶段1 @Damage[1d6[poison]]伤害，@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{呆滞 Stupefied 1}（1轮）

阶段2 @Damage[2d6[poison]]伤害，呆滞1和@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{笨拙 Clumsy 1}（1轮）

阶段3 @Damage[2d6[poison]]伤害，@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{呆滞 Stupefied 2}和@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{笨拙 Clumsy 2}（2轮）

Tough Skeletal Reveler.name: 强壮骷髅狂欢者 Tough Skeletal Reveler

Tough Small Opossum.name: Tough Small Opossum
Tough Small Opossum.allSaves: +2 circumstance to all saves vs. disease

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Disease.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Disease

Feign Death.name: Feign Death
Feign Death.description:
Trigger The opossum is reduced below 15 HP

Effect The opossum collapses. It is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} and can use actions that require only its mind, but any other action ends the ruse. A successful @Check[perception|dc:18|name:See Through Feign Death|traits:action:seek] check to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.BlAOM2X92SI6HMtJ]{Seek} or @Check[medicine|dc:18|name:See Through Feign Death|traits:action:recall-knowledge] check to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.1OagaWtBpVXExToo]{Recall Knowledge} is required to determine that the animal is not, in fact, dead.

Revived Retaliation.name: Revived Retaliation
Revived Retaliation.description:
Trigger The opossum is attacked or disturbed by a creature within reach while Feigning Death

Effect The opossum Strikes the triggering creature.

Scurry Underfoot.name: Scurry Underfoot
Scurry Underfoot.description: The opossum Strides up to half its speed. It can pass through other creatures' spaces during this movement, though it must end its movement in an unoccupied space.

Twigjack (PFS 2-08).name: 枝节妖 Twigjack (PFS 2-08)
Twigjack (PFS 2-08).publicNotes:
枝节妖是失调森林的住民，残酷且热爱恶作剧的精类及自身所处森林的结合作用下形成了他们。枝节妖的身体由多刺的荆棘以及藤蔓编织而成。在枝节妖头顶上生长的蓬松苔藓就宛如他的头发一般。细碎且破败的枝条在他脸上断裂开来形成了嘴部。新生的叶片和枝条随机地从他的身上伸展开来。格拉利昂的许多茂密森林中都至少有一小撮枝节妖生活在灌木丛中。

尽管具有暴力倾向且十分好斗，但枝节妖极为关心被他们认为属于自己的森林。这些生物会骚扰那些深入到自己的森林领域中的外来者，将其中哪怕最意志坚定的探索者、林务工作者、以及旅行者逼走，这种行为在那些入侵者于森林中开辟道路时尤甚。然而，在牵涉到其他森林生物时，他们并不会具有很强的领地意识。当木族生物，尤其是精类，集合起来对抗外部威胁时，该地区的枝节妖哪怕没有得到邀请，也会急切地前来参加战斗。

缺乏经验的冒险者在枝节妖那树荫蔽日的家园中与其遭遇时，往往会把他们误认为莱西，这一倾向经常会让枝节妖感到沮丧，因为他们对莱西的评价很差。更宽泛地来说，枝节妖讨厌被视同为活化的植物。与之相对的是，他们会欣然拥抱自己的精类血统——而这往往会导致愚蠢的结局。枝节妖费尽心思想要迎合生活在他们周围的精类生物。有数首流行的喜剧歌曲都描绘了类似的故事，即枝节妖试图追求一名强大、优雅的木妖精，但在数次笨拙的尝试后只落得丢人的滑稽结局。许多精类会对这些奇怪的表亲感到难堪，但部分斯普利坎、快可灵（Quickling）、和红帽精会为了达到自身的目的而控制并利用枝节妖的暴力冲动和破坏行为。

尽管枝节妖属于精类，而且在第一世界中不难找到，但有些不寻常地是，这些枝节妖很少信奉那些第一世界的始祖。相反，枝节妖们倾向于信奉自己设计的伪神：树枝纠缠成的人形、结成块的灌木丛、或者其他藏匿在自然界角落里的存在。这些宗教通常会高度本地化，尽管这些信仰通常不会引入神职人员，但它们却总是能激起针对非精类的狂热圣战。

Splinter Spray.name: 裂片飞溅 Splinter Spray
Splinter Spray.description:
枝节妖从体内发射大量裂片和荆棘，对@Template[cone|distance:15]范围内造成@Damage[4d6[piercing]]伤害(@Check[reflex|dc:20|basic]豁免)。

枝节妖在[[/gmr 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4轮}内无法再次使用裂片飞溅。

Unkillable Zombie Shambler.name: Unkillable Zombie Shambler
Unkillable Zombie Shambler.publicNotes:
A zombie shambler is a slow-moving horror dangerous in larger groups。

A zombie's only desire is to consume the living. Unthinking and ever-shambling harbingers of death, zombies stop only when they're destroyed。

Slow.name: Slow
Slow.description: A zombie is permanently @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} and can't use reactions.

(Zombie) Unkillable.name: (Zombie) Unkillable
(Zombie) Unkillable.description:
This zombie is nigh unkillable. The zombie loses its weakness to slashing and gains resistance against all damage equal to its level (minimum 3), and it gains weakness equal to twice its level (minimum 6) to critical hits.

Increase the zombie's level by 1 if you give it this ability.

Unstable Ice.name: Unstable Ice
Unstable Ice.disable: 2 @Check[athletics|dc:19|name:Move Ice|traits:environmental] to move the ice sheets into a more stable position
Unstable Ice.hazarddescription: The ice here is fractured due to the warming weather conditions and the inexorable flow of the ocean water below。

Drift.name: Drift
Drift.description:
Trigger A creature steps onto the unstable ice

Effect The weight and momentum of the creatures causes the fractured ice to shatter and separate, leaving them stranded on a floating iceberg.

Feed on Fear.name: Feed on Fear
Feed on Fear.description:
Requirements An enemy is being affected by a fear effect or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yZRUzMqrMmfLu0V1]{Dying} within 15 feet of the will-o'-wisp.

Effect Urkhas feeds on the creature's terror. It regains @Damage[1d4[healing]] Hit Points, and if it has Gone Dark, its glow reignites.

Urkhas can take this action only once per round.

Glow.name: Glow
Glow.description: 20 feet. Urkhas is itself naturally invisible, but glows with a violet light, casting bright light in the aura and making it visible.

Magic Immunity.name: Magic Immunity
Magic Immunity.description: Urkhas is immune to all spells except @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.HRb2doyaLtaoCfi3]{Faerie Fire}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.0qaqksrGGDj74HXE]{Revealing Light}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.gKKqvLohtrSJj3BM]{Force Barrage}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Oj1PJBMQD9vuwCv7]{Quandary}, and spells with the good trait.

Go Dark.name: Go Dark
Go Dark.description: Urkhas extinguishes its glow, becoming @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.zJxUflt9np0q4yML]{Invisible}. It can end this effect with another use of this action. If it uses its shock attack while invisible, the arc of electricity lets any observer determine its location, making the Urkhas only @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden} to all observers until it moves.

Glow.name: Glow
Glow.description: 20 feet. Urkhas is itself naturally invisible, but glows with a violet light, casting bright light in the aura and making it visible.

Magic Immunity.name: Magic Immunity
Magic Immunity.description: Urkhas is immune to all spells except @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.HRb2doyaLtaoCfi3]{Faerie Fire}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.0qaqksrGGDj74HXE]{Revealing Light}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.gKKqvLohtrSJj3BM]{Force Barrage}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Oj1PJBMQD9vuwCv7]{Quandary}, and spells with the good trait.

Effect Urkhas feeds on the creature's terror. It regains @Damage[1d6[healing]] Hit Points, and if it has Gone Dark, its glow reignites.

Urkhas can take this action only once per round.

Go Dark.description: Urkhas extinguishes its glow, becoming @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.zJxUflt9np0q4yML]{Invisible}. It can end this effect with another use of this action. If it uses its shock attack while invisible, the arc of electricity lets any observer determine its location, making the Urkhas only @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden} to all observers until it moves.

Urxehl's Firestorm (7-8).name: Urxehl's Firestorm (7-8)
Urxehl's Firestorm (7-8).disable: @Check[arcana|dc:28], @Check[nature|dc:28], @Check[occultism|dc:28], or @Check[religion|dc:28] (受训) twice or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (3rd level; counteract DC 22) to cause a temporary, local disruption to the Disciple of Urxehl's ritual. Checks to disrupt the firestorm require two actions. Defeating the Disciple of Urxehl also disables the hazard.
Urxehl's Firestorm (7-8).reset: The hazard activates when the PCs reach Event: Rain of Fire, area A1, and area A9. If the PCs defeat the Disciple of Urxehl, the hazard is permanently destroyed。

Urxehl's Ire.name: Urxehl's Ire
Urxehl's Ire.description:
Trigger A creature who doesn't worship Urxehl walks into the hazard's area

Effect The hazard rolls initiative as bolts of profane fire begin to target the intruders.

No MAP.name: No MAP
No MAP.description: Multiple Attack Penalties do not apply to the corrupted fire bolt strike.

Urxehl's Firestorm (9-10).name: Urxehl's Firestorm (9-10)
Urxehl's Firestorm (9-10).disable: @Check[arcana|dc:31], @Check[nature|dc:31], @Check[occultism|dc:31], or @Check[religion|dc:31] (受训) twice or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (4th level; counteract DC 24) to cause a temporary, local disruption to the Disciple of Urxehl's ritual. Checks to disrupt the firestorm require two actions. Defeating the Disciple of Urxehl also disables the hazard。
Urxehl's Firestorm (9-10).reset: The hazard activates when the PCs reach Event: Rain of Fire, area A1, and area A9. If the PCs defeat the Disciple of Urxehl, the hazard is permanently destroyed。

Urxehl's Ire.name: Urxehl's Ire
Urxehl's Ire.description:
Trigger A creature who doesn't worship Urxehl walks into the hazard's area

Effect The hazard rolls initiative as bolts of profane fire begin to target the intruders.

Death Frenzy.name: Death Frenzy
Death Frenzy.description:
Trigger The Usij acolyte is reduced to 0 Hit Points, and the acolyte can see or hear a div within 60 feet

Effect The Usij Acolyte makes a melee Strike before dying.

Death Frenzy.name: Death Frenzy
Death Frenzy.description:
Trigger The Usij cultist is reduced to 0 Hit Points, and the cultist can see or hear a div within 60 feet

Effect The Usij cultist makes a melee Strike before dying.

Flash of Insight.name: Flash of Insight
Flash of Insight.description:
Frequency once per day

Trigger Valgomorus is about to roll a d20

Effect The cyclops peers into an occluded spectrum of possible futures. He gets a success (but not a critical success) on the roll instead of rolling.

Drain Life.name: Drain Life
Drain Life.description:
When Valgomorus damages a living creature with his claw Strike, he gains 3 temporary Hit Points and the creature must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:16|options:inflicts:drained] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1}.

Further successful claw Strikes increase the drained value by 1 on a failed save, to a maximum of drained 4.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.LRIYUFQ7FE9H4RWD]{Effect: Drain Life}

Swipe.name: Swipe
Swipe.description: Valgomorus makes a melee Strike and compares the attack roll result to the AC of up to two foes, each of whom must be within its melee reach and adjacent to each other. Roll damage only once and apply it to each creature hit. A counts as two attacks for Valgomorus's multiple attack penalty, but the penalty does not increase until after both attacks are resolved.

Wight Spawn.name: Wight Spawn
Wight Spawn.description:
A living humanoid slain by Valgomorus's claw Strike rises as a spawned wight after [[/gmr 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}. This spawned wight is under the command of the wight that killed it (in this case, Valgomorus). It doesn't have drain life or wight spawn and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} for as long as it is a spawned wight.

If the creator of the spawned wight dies, the spawned wight becomes a full-fledged, autonomous wight; it regains its free will, gains drain life and wight spawn, and is no longer clumsy.

Flash of Insight.name: Flash of Insight
Flash of Insight.description:
Frequency once per day

Trigger Valgomorus is about to roll a d20

Effect Valgomorus peers into an occluded spectrum of possible futures. He gets a success (but not a critical success) on the roll instead of rolling.

Drain Life.name: Drain Life
Drain Life.description:
When Valgomorus damages a living creature with his claw Strike, he gains 3 temporary Hit Points and the creature must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:19|options:inflicts:drained] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1}.

Further successful claw Strikes increase the drained value by 1 on a failed save, to a maximum of drained 4.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.LRIYUFQ7FE9H4RWD]{Effect: Drain Life}

Swipe.name: Swipe
Swipe.description: Valgomorus makes a melee Strike and compares the attack roll result to the AC of up to two foes, each of whom must be within his melee reach and adjacent to each other. Roll damage only once and apply it to each creature hit. A counts as two attacks for the multiple attack penalty, though the penalty does not increase until after both attacks are resolved.

Inhabit Centaur Body.name: Inhabit Centaur Body
Inhabit Centaur Body.description:
While most vermleks inhabit Medium humanoids, Urxehl has granted this demon the ability to inhabit centaurs instead.

The vermlek crawls into the body of an adjacent dead centaur, consuming the bulk of the victim's skeleton and internal organs as it does so and cramming itself into the cavity.

The vermlek can wield weapons and use the centaur's Speed, hoof attack, and Trample ability. It also gains a +3 circumstance bonus to AC. While Inhabiting a Centaur body, a vermlek can't burrow.

It can't use this ability if it's already Inhabiting a Centaur Body.

Speed: 40, Burrow: 0 if Inhabiting a Cen.name: Speed: 40, Burrow: 0 if Inhabiting a Centaur body

Recoil from Wasted Opportunities.name: Recoil from Wasted Opportunities
Recoil from Wasted Opportunities.description: Vermleks cannot stand the sight of a good meal presented and then swiftly taken away. Whenever a dying creature within sight of the vermlek has its dying condition removed, the vermlek takes @Damage[1d6[mental]] damage.

Abandon Body.name: Abandon Body
Abandon Body.description:
Requirements The vermlek is Inhabiting a Centaur Body

Effect The vermlek crawls out of the body it is inhabiting, devouring much of the body's remaining flesh and regaining 15 Hit Points in the process. The corpse it leaves behind is little more than a husk.

Unsettling Movement.name: Unsettling Movement
Unsettling Movement.description:
Whenever the vermlek Abandons a Body or Inhabits a Body, all creatures within @Template[emanation|distance:30]{30 feet} who can see the vermlek must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:20] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}. On a critical failure, the creature is frightened 1 and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}.

Regardless of the result, creatures are immune to the same vermlek's unsettling movement for 24 hours.

Recoil from Wasted Opportunities.name: Recoil from Wasted Opportunities
Recoil from Wasted Opportunities.description: Vermleks cannot stand the sight of a good meal presented and then swiftly taken away. Whenever a dying creature within sight of the vermlek has its dying condition removed, the vermlek takes @Damage[1d6[mental]] damage.

Abandon Body.name: Abandon Body
Abandon Body.description:
Requirements The vermlek is Inhabiting a Centaur Body

Effect The vermlek crawls out of the body it is inhabiting, devouring much of the body's remaining flesh and regaining 15 Hit Points in the process. The corpse it leaves behind is little more than a husk.

Inhabit Centaur Body.name: Inhabit Centaur Body
Inhabit Centaur Body.description:
While most vermleks inhabit Medium humanoids, Urxehl has granted this demon the ability to inhabit centaurs instead.

The vermlek crawls into the body of an adjacent dead centaur, consuming the bulk of the victim's skeleton and internal organs as it does so and cramming itself into the cavity.

The vermlek can wield weapons and use the centaur's Speed, hoof attack, and Trample ability. It also gains a +3 circumstance bonus to AC. While Inhabiting a Centaur body, a vermlek can't burrow.

It can't use this ability if it's already Inhabiting a Centaur Body.

Speed: 40, Burrow: 0 if Inhabiting a Cen.name: Speed: 40, Burrow: 0 if Inhabiting a Centaur body

Unsettling Movement.name: Unsettling Movement
Unsettling Movement.description:
Whenever the vermlek Abandons a Body or Inhabits a Body, all creatures within @Template[emanation|distance:30]{30 feet} who can see the vermlek must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:23] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}. On a critical failure, the creature is frightened 1 and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}.

Regardless of the result, creatures are immune to the same vermlek's unsettling movement for 24 hours.

Weak Lion.name: Weak Lion
Weak Lion.publicNotes:
Lions are cooperative hunters, ambushing dangerous prey in groups of lionesses that work in tandem to trap and kill their prey. Male lions are typically larger, with long manes, and when they hunt, they tend to do so on their own。

Few predators of the natural world can match the cat's talent for stalking and stealth。

Pack Attack.name: Pack Attack
Pack Attack.description: The lion deals 1d4 extra damage to any creature that's within reach of at least two of the lion's allies.

Pounce.name: Pounce
Pounce.description: The lion Strides and makes a Strike at the end of that movement. If the lion began this action @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden}, it remains hidden until after this ability's Strike.

Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description: The lion deals 1d6 extra precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

Weak Mist Stalker.name: Weak Mist Stalker
Weak Mist Stalker.publicNotes:
The tentacled mist stalker shrouds itself in a cloak of mist through which its single, never-blinking eye can see with clarity, allowing it an advantage when stalking its prey。

Water elementals that become infused with cold or mist have increased mobility in regions outside of bodies of water。

Mist Cloud.name: Mist Cloud
Mist Cloud.description: 15 feet. The mist stalker is surrounded by mist. Creatures in the aura are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed}. If wind disperses the aura, it returns automatically at the start of the mist stalker's turn. This cloud is suppressed in water.

Mist Vision.name: Mist Vision
Mist Vision.description: The mist stalker ignores the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} condition from mist and fog.

Solidify Mist.name: Solidify Mist
Solidify Mist.description:
The mist stalker makes its mist cloud congeal, causing the aura to be difficult terrain until the start of the mist stalker's next turn.

In addition, the mist stalker can make the mist even thicker around a single Medium or smaller creature within the cloud. The creature must succeed at a @Check[reflex|dc:18] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} until it @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escapes} or it is no longer in the mist cloud's emanation.

Weak Mudwretch.name: Weak Mudwretch
Weak Mudwretch.publicNotes:
In its resting form, a mudwretch looks like a large puddle of thick, dark mud, heaped at the center in a slightly drier patch of loam. When a living creature approaches, though, the mudwretch lurches upward, piling its muddy flesh upon itself to form a roughly humanoid shape, often in vague mockery of the approaching creature's general form in cases where the creature is a humanoid itself。

Mudwretches possess a low level of intellect, and while they do not form societies or cultures of their own, they are attracted to ruins or abandoned settlements. They have little need to eat, but without a constant source of moisture, a mudwretch dries out, suffering from low throbbing aches until it can resaturate. Often, blood from living creatures has to do-a dried mudwretch is more dangerous to intruders than one that's comfortably wallowing on a river bank。

Muddy Field.name: Muddy Field
Muddy Field.description: 10 feet. The ground in the area is difficult terrain for all non-mudwretch creatures.

Susceptible to Desiccation.name: Susceptible to Desiccation
Susceptible to Desiccation.description:
If a mudwretch takes any damage from @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.M0jQlpQYUr0pp2Sv]{Desiccate} or a similar effect, takes 10 or more fire damage from a single effect, or spends more than 24 hours outside of a source of sufficient hydration (such as a swamp, river, well, or recent rainfall), it becomes dehydrated.

While dehydrated, the mudwretch can't Spew Mud, is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2}, and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} until it either fully immerses in water, spends 1 minute in the rain, or rehydrates in another way (such as via Gory Hydration).

Gory Hydration.name: Gory Hydration
Gory Hydration.description:
Requirements The mudwretch is dehydrated

Trigger The mudwretch deals Constrict damage to a living creature that has blood

Effect The mudwretch squeezes harder, dealing @Damage[1d4[bleed]] to the target. The mudwretch absorbs this blood, removing any penalties it had as a result of being dehydrated.

Mud Puddle.name: Mud Puddle
Mud Puddle.description: Until it next acts, the mudwretch appears to be an ordinary puddle of mud. It has an automatic result of 20 on Deception checks to pass as a mud puddle and can make a fist Strike against a creature that walks onto the mud puddle as a reaction.

Spew Mud.name: Spew Mud
Spew Mud.description:
The mudwretch spews a @Template[line|distance:20] of pressurized mud that deals @Damage[2d8[bludgeoning]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:16|basic|options:area-effect] save). On a critical failure, a creature also takes a –10-foot status penalty to its Speeds for 1 round.

The mudwretch can't Spew Mud again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Spew Mud]]{1d4 rounds}.

Weak Sea Devil Scout.name: Weak Sea Devil Scout
Weak Sea Devil Scout.publicNotes:
Scouts, among the lowliest of sea devils, ply the inky waters of the ocean in search of aquatic prey, tread ashore to gauge landborne threats, or charge into battle with the advance forces of a greater sea devil war party。

Sea devils are horrid, amphibious humanoids who lurk in Golarion's oceans and crawl ashore to steal away victims beneath the veil of darkness. When an entire fishing village disappears overnight, sea devils are the first suspects。

Far from mindless monstrosities, sea devils are terribly intelligent, with a cunning limited only by their strict adherence to hierarchy. They call themselves "sahuagin" but have wholly embraced their enemies' name for their kind as their own. Their cultural militancy enables sea devils to act in concert to perform grand acts of sabotage, marauding, and pillaging, and only the strongest (and most conniving) members of the tribe make it to the top of the social ladder. For all their discipline, however, sea devils are widely known to snap into murderous frenzies at the scent of blood. Even the best-laid plans can fall apart when a sea devil breaks ranks to revel in the spilled blood of their victims, an indulgence that can quickly cause a chain reaction of bloodthirsty ecstasy throughout an entire raiding party. For this reason, sea devils typically capture landborne quarry using nets and ropes, dragging them to the depths of the sea before making even a single incision。

Among sea devil society, individuals are rewarded based on their performance during hunts and shore excursions, with rebels and outliers quickly culled from the ranks. Every pup is given a fair chance, however, and even the lowest-born sea devil can strive for the rank of commander, general, or perhaps even king or queen. Sea devils in positions of leadership tend to be among the largest, most violent, and most calculating of their kind, and fully realized sea devils are skilled warriors capable of capturing entire villages on their own. The most powerful sea devils are mighty kings and queens who coordinate the activity of lesser sea devils across territories spanning leagues, foiling attempts at their positions via manufactured blood feuds and wars against their numerous enemies ashore and underwater。

Shark Commune 150 feet.name: Shark Commune 150 feet
Shark Commune 150 feet.description: The sea devil can communicate telepathically with sharks within range. It can communicate only simple concepts like "come," "guard," or "attack."

Spore Burst.name: Spore Burst
Spore Burst.description: When an abyssal fungus dies, it triggers its Spore Cloud ability immediately.

Spore Cloud.name: Spore Cloud
Spore Cloud.description: An abyssal fungus can unleash a cloud of spores that irritates the eyes and throats of non-fungus creatures in a @Template[emanation|distance:15]. Each creature must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:12|options:area-effect,damaging-effect] save or take @Damage[1d4[persistent,poison]|options:area-damage]. A creature has its vision reduced as long as the persistent damage continues and can see only within 20 feet (10 feet on a critical failure).

Spores.name: Spores
Spores.description: A creature that takes damage from an abyssal fungus' ranged spore pod Strike must attempt a saving throw with the same DC and effect as its Spore Cloud ability.

Dissociate.name: Dissociate
Dissociate.description:
Trigger The wind malevolent would be hit by an effect that deals bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage

Effect The wind malevolent dissociates into component elemental wisps while vaguely retaining its weasel-like form. This grants it bludgeoning resistance 5, piercing resistance 5, slashing resistance 5, weakness 5 to area damage, and weakness 5 to splash damage. While in this dissociated form, it can't use its vacuum sickle Strike. The wind malevolent automatically re-forms into its normal form at the beginning of its next turn.

Dissociate.name: Dissociate
Dissociate.description:
Trigger The wind malevolent would be hit by an effect that deals bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage

Effect The wind malevolent dissociates into component elemental wisps while vaguely retaining its weasel-like form. This grants it bludgeoning resistance 7, piercing resistance 7, slashing resistance 7, weakness 5 to area damage, and weakness 5 to splash damage. While in this dissociated form, it can't use its vacuum sickle Strike. The wind malevolent automatically re-forms into its normal form at the beginning of its next turn.

Wishbound Vision.name: Wishbound Vision
Wishbound Vision.description: The belker is accustomed to working together with the mist stalkers and ignores the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} condition from both smoke and mist.

Smoke Form.name: Smoke Form
Smoke Form.description: The belker can occupy the same space as other creatures.

Noxious Fumes.name: Noxious Fumes
Noxious Fumes.description:
Requirements The belker is occupying the same space as a Medium or smaller creature

Effect The belker attempts to flow into the creature's lungs; the creature must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:21] save. On a failure, the creature partially inhales the belker and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} by the pain of the smoke rasping in its throat and lungs. The creature can attempt to exhale the belker by spending an action coughing and succeeding at a @Check[fortitude|dc:21] save.

Most of the belker remains outside the creature, so the belker can still act normally. If the belker moves out of the creature's space or uses again, the creature automatically exhales it.

Smoke Slash.name: Smoke Slash
Smoke Slash.description:
Requirements The belker is partially inhaled by a creature

Effect The belker automatically deals its claw damage to the inhaling creature by forming a claw to slash and scrape the creature from within.

Noxious Fumes.name: Noxious Fumes
Noxious Fumes.description:
Requirements The belker is occupying the same space as a Medium or smaller creature

Effect The belker attempts to flow into the creature's lungs; the creature must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:24] save. On a failure, the creature partially inhales the belker and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} by the pain of the smoke rasping in its throat and lungs. The creature can attempt to exhale the belker by spending an action coughing and succeeding at a @Check[fortitude|dc:24] save.

Most of the belker remains outside the creature, so the belker can still act normally. If the belker moves out of the creature's space or uses again, the creature automatically exhales it.

Wishbound Vision.name: Wishbound Vision
Wishbound Vision.description: The belker is accustomed to working together with the mist stalkers and ignores the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} condition from both smoke and mist.

Smoke Form.name: Smoke Form
Smoke Form.description: The belker can occupy the same space as other creatures.

Smoke Slash.name: Smoke Slash
Smoke Slash.description:
Requirements The belker is partially inhaled by a creature

Effect The belker automatically deals its claw damage to the inhaling creature by forming a claw to slash and scrape the creature from within.

Mist Vision.name: Mist Vision
Mist Vision.description: The mist stalker ignores the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} condition from mist and fog.

Solidify Mist.name: Solidify Mist
Solidify Mist.description: The mist stalker makes its mist cloud congeal, causing the aura to be difficult terrain until the start of the mist stalker's next turn. In addition, the mist stalker can make the mist even thicker around a single Medium or smaller creature within the cloud. The creature must succeed at a @Check[reflex|dc:18|name:Solidfy Mist] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} until it Escapes or it is no longer in the mist cloud's emanation.

Mist Cloud.name: Mist Cloud
Mist Cloud.description: 15 feet. The mist stalker is surrounded by mist. Creatures in the aura are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed}. If wind disperses the aura, it returns automatically at the start of the mist stalker's turn. This cloud is suppressed in water.

Mist Vision.name: Mist Vision
Mist Vision.description: The mist stalker ignores the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} condition from mist and fog.

Mist Cloud.name: Mist Cloud
Mist Cloud.description: 15 feet. The mist stalker is surrounded by mist. Creatures in the aura are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed}. If wind disperses the aura, it returns automatically at the start of the mist stalker's turn. This cloud is suppressed in water.

Solidify Mist.name: Solidify Mist
Solidify Mist.description: The mist stalker makes its mist cloud congeal, causing the aura to be difficult terrain until the start of the mist stalker's next turn. In addition, the mist stalker can make the mist even thicker around a single Medium or smaller creature within the cloud. The creature must succeed at a @Check[reflex|dc:21|name:Solidfy Mist] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} until it Escapes or it is no longer in the mist cloud's emanation.

Shell Block.name: Shell Block
Shell Block.description:
Trigger A creature adjacent to the dragon turtle targets it with a melee attack.

Effect The dragon turtle rolls its shell toward the triggering creature, gaining a +2 circumstance bonus to its AC against the triggering attack.

Breath Weapon.name: Breath Weapon
Breath Weapon.description:
The dragon turtle breathes a massive blast of steam that deals @Damage[6d6[fire]|options:area-damage] damage to creatures within a @Template[cone|distance:40] (@Check[reflex|dc:21|basic|options:area-effect] save). This steam blast affects creatures within the water, as well as outside.

The dragon turtle can't use its Breath Weapon again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Breath Weapon]]{1d4 rounds}.

Capsize.name: Capsize
Capsize.description: The dragon turtle tries to capsize an adjacent aquatic vessel of its size or smaller. The dragon turtle must succeed at an Athletics check with a DC of 24 or the pilot's Sailing Lore DC, whichever is higher.

Draconic Frenzy.name: Draconic Frenzy
Draconic Frenzy.description: The dragon turtle makes two claw Strikes and one jaws Strike in any order.

Shell Block.name: Shell Block
Shell Block.description:
Trigger A creature adjacent to the dragon turtle targets it with a melee attack.

Effect The dragon turtle rolls its shell toward the triggering creature, gaining a +2 circumstance bonus to its AC against the triggering attack.

Breath Weapon.name: Breath Weapon
Breath Weapon.description:
The dragon turtle breathes a massive blast of steam that deals @Damage[8d6[fire]|options:area-damage] damage to creatures within a @Template[cone|distance:40] (@Check[reflex|dc:24|basic|options:area-effect] save). This steam blast affects creatures within the water, as well as outside.

The dragon turtle can't use its Breath Weapon again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Breath Weapon]]{1d4 rounds}.

Draconic Frenzy.name: Draconic Frenzy
Draconic Frenzy.description: The dragon turtle makes two claw Strikes and one jaws Strike in any order.

Capsize.name: Capsize
Capsize.description: The dragon turtle tries to capsize an adjacent aquatic vessel of its size or smaller. The dragon turtle must succeed at an Athletics check with a DC of 27 or the pilot's Sailing Lore DC, whichever is higher.

Yeth Warbeast.name: Yeth Warbeast
Yeth Warbeast.publicNotes:
Wicked canine creatures who live for the thrill of the hunt, yeth hounds often serve evil masters as guardians and trackers. Yeth hounds resemble lean, sleek dogs with overlarge ears and narrow paws that can tread on air as easily as the ground. Despite their canine appearance, yeth hounds are remarkably intelligent, although they rarely display this intelligence except when devising intricate tactics to ensnare their quarry. Their eerie bays echo across the countryside when they are engaged in a hunt, and they particularly enjoy baying to frighten and disorient intelligent creatures. Yeth hound packs can number as many as a dozen members, each working in uncanny communion with its packmates to corner and kill their prey. Yeth hounds like to drag their victims back to their lairs to eat at their leisure, so these lairs often contain discarded treasures from the hounds' previous meals。

Yeth hounds despise two things: sunlight and other canines. They hunt only at night if they can, often breaking off their hunt at dawn to retreat to a subterranean lair or den, no matter how close they had come to catching their prey. Yeth hounds usually attack wargs, wolves, and similar creatures on sight, working to drive larger or more powerful canines from their hunting areas when then can't simply overpower and kill them。

Evil rangers, bestial demons, and wicked cults are frequently gifted yeth hound servants by fiendish patrons. Such hounds often serve as spies and are quick to turn against those who fail to advance the patrons' wicked aims. The cult of Lamashtu, in particular, is fond of using yeth hounds as temple guardians。

Bay.name: Bay
Bay.description:
The yeth warbeast emits an unearthly howl audible up to @Template[emanation|distance:300]{300 feet} feet away. Any non-fiend creature that hears the howl must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:25] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}. Any creature that critically fails and is within @Template[emanation|distance:60]{60 feet} of the yeth warbeast is instead @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 3} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.sDPxOjQ9kx2RZE8D]{Fleeing} for [[/gmr 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds} (or until it recovers from its frightened condition).

Whether it succeeds or fails the saving throw, the creature is then temporarily immune to Bay for 24 hours.

Ear-splitting Howl.name: Ear-splitting Howl
Ear-splitting Howl.description:
The yeth warbeast releases a piercing bark that deals @Damage[8d6[sonic]|options:area-damage] damage in a @Template[cone|distance:20] (@Check[reflex|dc:25|basic|options:area-effect] save). A creature that critically fails also becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}, or increases the value of its frightened condition by 1 if already frightened.

The warbeast can't use Ear-Splitting Howl again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Ear-splitting Howl]]{1d4 rounds}.

Sinister Bite.name: Sinister Bite
Sinister Bite.description: A good creature bitten by a yeth hound must attempt a @Check[will|dc:25] save. On a critical success, the creature is temporarily immune to sinister bite for 1 minute. A creature that fails becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}, or increases the value of its frightened condition by 1 if already frightened.

Ygracix.name: Ygracix
Ygracix.publicNotes:
Imps are infiltrators and corruptors who, despite their diminutive stature, are more than capable of subtly influencing a weak-willed individual into performing increasingly evil acts over time. An imp will often agree to serve a mortal and act docile and loyal in a long-term plot to eventually damn its master's soul to Hell. Imps are born directly from Hell itself, rather than from mortal souls, and thus they serve outside the usual diabolic hierarchy, granting them leeway to pursue their specialties. Despite standing a mere 2-feet tall, imps can be vicious combatants, flying out of reach and turning invisible to escape should the odds turn against them。

Masters of corruption and architects of conquest, devils seek both to tempt mortal life to join in their pursuit of all things profane and to spread tyranny throughout all worlds. The temptations they offer mortals range from great powers granted by the signing of an infernal contract to twisted favors following a whispered pledge to a diabolic patron, or any number of even subtler exchanges. Those who succumb to these temptations find themselves consigned to an afterlife of endless torment in the pits of Hell, wherein the only hope of escape lies in the chance of being promoted to become a devil in the infernal ranks. Every devil has a specific role to play in the upkeep of the remorseless bureaucratic machine that is Hell, from soldiers and scholars to inquisitors, lawyers, judges, and executioners. Lowly lemures and imps perform subservient labor to more powerful and specialized devils, such as contract devils and erinyes, while the greatest pit fiends command entire infernal armies。

Change Shape.name: Change Shape
Change Shape.description:
• Boar
    • Size Medium
    • @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.rqfnQ5VHT5hxm25r]{Scent (Imprecise) 30 feet}
    • Speed 40 feet
    • Melee tusk [[/r 1d20+9 #Tusk]]{+9}/[[/r 1d20+4 #Tusk]]{+4}/[[/r 1d20-1 #Tusk]]{-1} (finesse), Damage @Damage[(1d10-1)[piercing]] damage
  • Giant Spider
    • Size Medium
    • Speed 25 feet, climb 25 feet
    • Melee fangs [[/r 1d20+9 #Fangs]]{+9}/[[/r 1d20+4 #Fangs]]{+4}/[[/r 1d20-1 #Fangs]]{-1} (finesse, poison), Damage @Damage[(1d6-1)[piercing],1d4[poison]]{1d6-1 piercing damage plus 1d4 poison damage}
  • Rat
    • @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.rqfnQ5VHT5hxm25r]{Scent}
    • Speed 20 feet
    • Melee jaws [[/r 1d20+9 #Jaws]]{+9}/[[/r 1d20+5 #Jaws]]{+5}/[[/r 1d20+1 #Jaws]]{+1} (agile, finesse), Damage @Damage[1[piercing]] damage
  • Raven
    • @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.rqfnQ5VHT5hxm25r]{Scent}
    • Speed 10 feet, fly 40 feet
    • Melee beak [[/r 1d20+9 #Beak]]{+9}/[[/r 1d20+4 #Beak]]{+4}/[[/r 1d20-1 #Beak]]{-1} (finesse), Damage @Damage[1[piercing]] damage

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

Infernal Temptation.name: Infernal Temptation
Infernal Temptation.description:
Frequency once per day.

Effect The imp offers a non-fiend within 15 feet a bargain, granting a boon of good luck if the creature accepts. The boon lasts for 1 hour once accepted.

If the creature dies while the boon is in place, its soul travels to Hell, where it is bound for eternity and unable to be raised or resurrected except by @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.6dDtGIUerazSHIOu]{Wish} or similar magic.

Once during the hour, the creature can roll an attack roll or saving throw twice and use the higher result.

Diabolic Healing.name: Diabolic Healing
Diabolic Healing.description:
Frequency once per round.

Effect The imp regains @Damage[1d6[healing]] Hit Points.

Imp Venom.name: Imp Venom
Imp Venom.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:16]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[1d6[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[1d6[poison]] damage, clumsy 1, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} (1 round)

Young Ahuizotl.name: Young Ahuizotl
Young Ahuizotl.publicNotes:
The ahuizotl is a vicious, semi-aquatic predator that resembles a hideous cross between a badger and an otter, with disturbingly web-fingered paws supplemented by a fifth hand at the end of a long, serpentine tail. A clever and stealthy hunter, the ahuizotl lures unwary prey to their doom by mimicking the cries of people in distress。

The ahuizotl's macabre habit of feeding on a victim's eyes, fingernails, and teeth leaves the corpses of its kills uniquely mutilated. Some say the creatures consider these body parts delicacies, while others insist ahuizotls collect them as tribute to a powerful but unknown entity。

The fact that an ahuizotl does not eat the actual flesh of its victims, instead depositing their savaged and waterlogged corpses in locations where the remains are sure to be found by friends or family, points to a third and perhaps more likely possibility-the ahuizotl simply enjoys using its violent dietary quirks to spread fear and despair。

An ahuizotl walks on all fours, but its hands are capable of manipulating simple tools and other objects. Ahuizotls have roughly mustelid features and an extra membrane covering their eyes, giving their eyes a dull color suggestive of cataracts and somewhat blunting the creature's vision。

Yet despite their bestial appearance, ahuizotls are nearly as intelligent as the average human, and wiser than most. Although they don't form societies of their own, they have been known to ally with violent cults or conclaves of monsters, and even to found small shrines and temples to sinister deities。

The cult of Charon, the horseman of Death, is particularly popular among certain ahuizotls, who look forward to an afterlife spent wallowing in the waters of the River Styx。

Tail Drag.name: Tail Drag
Tail Drag.description:
Requirements The ahuizotl has a Medium or smaller creature grabbed with its tail claw

Effect The ahuizotl attempts an @Check[athletics|defense:fortitude] check against the creature's Fortitude DC.

Critical Success If the creature is 10 feet away from the ahuizotl, it is dragged into a square adjacent to the ahuizotl. The ahuizotl can make a jaws Strike against the creature.

Success If the creature is 10 feet away from the ahuizotl, it is dragged into a square adjacent to the ahuizotl.

Failure The creature is not dragged.

Critical Failure The creature is not dragged and the ahuizotl no longer has the creature grabbed.

Voice Imitation.name: Voice Imitation
Voice Imitation.description: An ahuizotl can mimic the sounds of a person in distress by attempting a Deception check to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.ewwCglB7XOPLUz72]{Lie}. The ahuizotl has a +4 circumstance bonus to this check.

Slow.name: Slow
Slow.description: A zombie is permanently @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} and can't use reactions.

Tangling Kelp.name: Tangling Kelp
Tangling Kelp.description:
Trigger A creature attempts a melee attack against a zombie grindylow with a bludgeoning or slashing weapon

Effect The creature must succeed at a @Check[reflex|dc:13] saving throw or become tangled in the kelp that surrounds the zombie grindylow, giving the creature a -10 circumstance penalty to its Speeds until it spends a manipulate action to remove the kelp.
